name: DB_cutscene_summary_10301020
text: Ban happens upon a collapsed girl, and her brother mistakenly blames Ban for her condition. When the girl wakes and clears things up, the boy apologies. Suddenly, someone delivers a fatal blow to Ban.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10301040
text: Meliodas and crew arrive at Post Town Tala, a village said to be connected to the Capital of the Dead. Meliodas opens the Boar Hat for business and recon, assigning everyone a job. Ban runs away, however.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10301050
text: Meliodas stops the fight between Ban and the mysterious boy. The boy is revealed to be King. He quietly leaves the scene when Diane appears.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10301070
text: Ban serves a tasty meal to the starving Ellen and Luigi. Ban asks them to tell him how to get to the Capital of the Dead in return for the meal. Ellen says cherished memories shared with the deceased will lead him there. The group manages to gain access to the Capital of the Dead thanks of the memories shared between Ban and Elaine. King, who'd been keeping an eye on them, follows them to the capital.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10301080
text: King is curious about the relationship between Meliodas and Elizabeth. He's astonished to learn that Elizabeth is a princess.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10301090
text: King's powerful magic at the Capital of the Dead was from his Sacred Treasure, and he claims the other Deadly Sins hold similar strength. Too bad Meliodas, Diane, and Ban no longer have their Sacred Treasures.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10301100
text: There are rumors of a Giant hammer getting transported to Vaizel. Diane cannot enter Vaizel because she is a Giant. Elizabeth and Diane decide to stay behind at the tavern.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10302010
text: After following Ban into the Capital of the Dead, King stands in his way again. Ban still has a hard time believing that King is who he says he is.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10302020
text: Ban asks King why he keeps showing up. King reveals that the saint Ban had killed was King's younger sister.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10302030
text: Meliodas and crew meet Guila while searching for Ban. Sensing great danger from Guila, Meliodas tells Hawk to take Elizabeth and run away as far as he can.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10302040
text: Guila seems fairly composed even after being hit with Meliodas's "Full Counter." In fact, Guila tells Meliodas to work harder to meet her expectations.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10302050
text: Ban discovers why King has been acting hostile. King uses his "Fossilization" to turn Ban into stone. Surprisingly, Ban doesn't put up a fight.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10302060
text: Elaine kisses Ban and restores him from petrification. Elaine tells King that his impression of Ban is all a misunderstanding.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10302070
text: Meliodas and Diane struggle to defend themselves against Guila's attacks. Ban finally joins them to fight Guila.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10302080
text: Even with Ban joining the fray, [The Seven Deadly Sins] are rendered helpless by Guila's powerful attacks.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10302090
text: King joins the team after Elaine asks him to protect Ban. Guila is willing to fight alone against all four of them, but King faces off against her on his own.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10302100
text: King uses the incredibly powerful magic from his Sacred Treasure to subdue Guila. At that moment, the Capital of the Dead finally rejects the living and returns them to Post Town Tala.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10305010
text: It is said that a dead woman's shrieks of resentment ceaselessly echo through the Forest of Screams. The party finds the rumors to be true as soon as they walk into the forest. They discover that the cries were actually coming from Screamers.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10305020
text: It's common knowledge that Screamers don't stray too far from their habitat. Meliodas says this is the first time he's come across this many.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10305030
text: Screams echo throughout the forest once more. Something's different this time, however. The cries were coming from a girl.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10305040
text: A girl says Knights took her family and other villagers. Ban asks if the Knights are resorting to Human trafficking.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10351020
text: The deserters run when they recognize Ban. Hawk tries to go after them, but Meliodas stops him.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10351040
text: Bruno says the farm is a side job to supplement his tiny income. He makes a so-called panacea out of Screamer Root and sells them to unsuspecting customers.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10352020
text: Hawk and Meliodas are bickering as usual. King says it feels like there's someone in the forest watching them.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10352040
text: Elizabeth suddenly appears before Meliodas, but he realizes that it's not really her.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10352060
text: Meliodas manages to shake off the Nightmare of Illusion's seductive dreams. He sets off to find and wake everyone else sleeping in the forest.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10353020
text: King and Ban are confused when they wake up from the dreams. They then set off to find the still-sleeping Diane and Elizabeth.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10353040
text: When Hawk wakes up, he can't accept that all the food had been a dream. He throws a tantrum and demands scraps.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10353060
text: Just like Hawk, Diane tries to deny reality when she wakes up. It seems she was dreaming of a life in which she and Meliodas were newlyweds.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10354010
text: Elizabeth says she heard a woman's plaintive voice asking her to go to the Village of Vengeful Spirits and save someone named Boris. They arrive to find that the village is incredibly dreary.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10354020
text: Elizabeth remembers what happened here and tells the group. Many suffered under the nobles' ruleand died unfairly. A guardian Knight who died during that time was a man named Boris.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10354030
text: Filled with resentment over their unjust deaths, Specters wander the village, unable to move on. Elizabeth sympathizes with them, but Meliodas says these spirits need to be put to rest.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10354040
text: Elizabeth thinks about Melia, the woman Boris loved. She wonders if the voice she heard in the Capital of the Dead that asked her to save Boris could've been Melia's.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10354050
text: Meliodas and crew wander the village square, where Boris met his end. Boris the Headless Knight finally makes an appearance.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10354060
text: Boris seems to come to his senses when he hears the name Melia. He says he can't join Melia and vanishes.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10355030
text: Meliodas and crew get surrounded by soldiers in the graveyard. Boris appears once more, but as nothing more than a soulless shell.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10355040
text: Hawk is scared out of his mind when he sees the dead soldiers moving around. Hawk asks if they're dead or alive, but Meliodas has only vague answers for him, which angers Hawk.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10355050
text: Necromancers have the power to control the dead. A necromancer was responsible for animating the corpses buried in the Dark Grave.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10355060
text: The soldiers disappear when the Ruler of Greed is defeated. The dead can now finally rest in peace.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10401020
text: Meliodas and group find Diane's Gideon in Vaizel. They decide to participate in the Vaizel Fight Festival to recover Gideon.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10401040
text: Only seven participants qualify for the quarterfinals instead of eight. King is criticized for exploiting a loophole to stay in the ring, but he still ends up becoming a contestant in the quarterfinals.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10401060
text:
Lots are drawn to decide the
Vaizel Fight Festival quarterfinals lineup.
Group 1 is Griamore vs. Matrona.
Group 2 is Howzer vs. Taizoo.
Group 3 is Cain vs. Old Fart.
Group 4 is Meliodaf vs. Vaan.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10401080
text: The first battle of the Fight Festival quarterfinals is Griamore vs. Matrona. Abiding by the rules, Matrona removes her cape, revealing the Boar Hat uniform underneath! She defeats Griamore with her staggering power. Who is Matrona?

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10401090
text: The mighty and mysterious Matrona is revealed to be a tiny Diane. She and Elizabeth had gone into the forest looking for ingredients, and a giant Chicken Matango's spores shrank them.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10401091
text: Griamore tells Howzer that some of the Fight Festival's participants are [The Seven Deadly Sins]. Rather than carry out his duties, like arresting traitors or looking for Princess Elizabeth, Howzer runs to the arena, excited by the prospect of seeing [The Seven Deadly Sins] display their powers.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10401100
text: Meliodas is squaring off against Ban in the Fight Festival's quarterfinals. Ban drives Meliodas back with his fierce attacks, then delivers a final blow. Somehow, Meliodas manages to withstand the blow and remain in the ring.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10401110
text: Diane wins the fight against Howzer. She insists she's not one of [The Seven Deadly Sins], but Howzer doesn't seem to believe her. Cain, who'd been watching them, mutters something incomprehensible and prepares to fight Meliodas in the semifinals.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10401120
text: Meliodas's opponent in the semifinals is the mysterious old man, Cain. It turns out he was Barzard the Flame, a Holy Knight of Danafor. He used to believe that Meliodas annihilated Danafor, but is overjoyed to learn the truth from Meliodas and withdraws from the Fight Festival as a result.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10401140
text: Meliodas and crew suddenly change their tune and begin intimidating the spectators, saying they're taking over Vaizel. A ball of flame suddenly drops from the sky, and the festival instantly descends into chaos.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10401150
text: Meliodas faces a dilemma when the Holy Knights begin attacking Vaizel. He finally decides to give the fight his all, and vows to bring an end to the endless cycle of violence.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10402010
text: Guila, last seen at the Capital of the Dead, appears to have grown much stronger. She steps forth, wanting revenge for her defeat in the last fight.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10402020
text: Hawk sprints off with Elizabeth on his back to get away as far from the battle as possible. When Hawk tells Elizabeth he'll protect her no matter what, she says that everyone must stick together to survive.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10402021
text: A sword flies at Ban as he wanders the ruined villageand a swordswoman appears before him. She introduces herself as Jericho, and says they met in Baste Prison.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10402022
text: Ban mocks Jericho, but is quietly surprised by her sudden increase in power. She subdues him, and says she endured many hardships to get to where she is.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10402023
text: After evacuating the civilians, King is shocked to find Ban and Meliodas wounded from Jericho and Guila's attacks. The two coordinate an attack against King before he has a chance to rescue Ban and Meliodas.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10402024
text: Guila and Jericho's combined attacks don't faze King at all. He leaves Meliodas and Ban to Hawk before going into battle to stop Guila and Jericho.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10402025
text: Howzer appears before Diane who is confused by the disappearance of Gideon. He attempts to arrest her for treason, but is taken aback when she denies the charge. Howzer's ally Marmas suddenly appears and attacks Diane.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10402026
text: Diane falls into the cracked earth after Marmas's attack.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10402030
text: Elizabeth and Veronica reunite in Vaizel. Veronica insists that Meliodas is a destructive monster, and tries to force Elizabeth to return to Liones Castle.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10402040
text: Veronica seals Meliodas away in the Goddess Amber. Elizabeth pleads with her to release him, but Veronica says that she doesn't know how.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10402050
text: To stop King from attacking Guila and Jericho, the referee Love Helm steps between them. Love Helm's true identity turns out to be Cardinal Helbram.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10402060
text: King is stunned to see his old friend so unexpectedly. He has a hard time defending himself against Helbram's barrage of attacks.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10402061
text: Griamore traps Elizabeth in the "Perfect Shell." Veronica wants to take Elizabeth back to the castle like this because she refuses to listen to Veronica. Ban suddenly appears and threatens Griamore by taking Veronica hostage.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10402070
text: Guila demands Veronica hand over Meliodas and Elizabeth, but Veronica refuses. Freed from the barrier, Elizabeth takes the opportunity to escape.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10402071
text: Guila and Jericho want to take Elizabeth and Veronica and Griamore stand in their way. Elizabeth attempts her escape while they argue amongst themselves.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10402080
text: While chasing Elizabeth, Veronica is mortally wounded when she shields Elizabeth from Guila's bomb. Elizabeth holds the fallen Veronica in her arms and grieves.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10402081
text: Elizabeth weeps over the death of her sister. At that moment, the seal on the Goddess Amber breaks. The figure that emerges is Meliodas, but with a different appearance.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10402090
text: Meliodas looks different when he is released from the seal. Unsettled by the change, Ban attacks him, but is unable to beat the transformed Meliodas.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10402091
text: Helbram looks on at the changed Meliodas. Apparently amused by Meliodas's new form, Helbram starts to fight him.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10402100
text: Diane recovers her Sacred Treasure Gideon and draws out its innate power. Helbram quickly takes his leave, bringing the collapsed Guila and Jericho with him. The battle is over, but Meliodas's sword has been stolen.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10450010
text: Meliodas and crew are searching a large forest for Basti, the master of hiding. They end up finding Basti hiding behind a rather suspicious barrel of ale.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10450011
text: The Patrol Gorra calls Basti a traitor for communicating with Humans. Basti shoots back, saying the Gorra are slaves who have surrendered to the Walkers.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10450020
text: Meliodas and crew defeat the Patrol Gorra, but Basti isn't very grateful. Basti says powerful Walkers rule the Gorra, and they push the Gorra to fight the Humans.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10450030
text: Basti says he can't trust Humans because they don't like the Gorra. Suddenly, someone throws a bomb at the group. They manage to avoid the explosion, but the Gorra that had been lying in wait emerge.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10450031
text: The Gorra tell Basti that it's not too late to beg for forgiveness. Basti argues that it's the chieftain who needs to beg for forgiveness.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10450040
text: The Gorra chieftain lost his siblings to the Walkers. Despite this, he says he no longer wants to fight the Walkers.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10450050
text: The Chieftain Gorra calls Basti a traitor for bringing Humans. Basti protests, saying the Gorra are the Walkers's slaves. The chieftain stands firm and tells him they will eventually claim independence after gaining power and influence.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10450051
text: Vowing to crush any hints of rebellion, the Chieftain Gorra attacks. He doesn't back down from his assertion that he is helping the Gorra.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10450060
text: Meliodas and crew eliminate the Chieftain Gorra. Basti feels remorse for having a hand in his death, but he promises to never give up on his work to free the Gorra.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10451010
text: The crew heads deep into Walker territory. There, they discover a wanted poster with King's face on it. A Patrol Gorra says he will be killed if he loses the wanted poster.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10451011
text: Sensing how strong Meliodas and crew are, the Gorra says he'll spare them as long as they leave the wanted poster. Ban is determined to find out why the Gorra is so obsessed with it.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10451020
text: The crew overpowers the Gorra and find out why he's so obsessed with the poster. The Patrol Gorra says the Walker Queen Hark wants to find the man in the poster and marry him.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10451030
text: The Walker Queen wants to make King her husband. When the Walkers see King's other form, they say he looks like the man on the poster.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10451031
text: Indeed, King the man the Walkers were looking for. Ban seems to think following the Walkers around is no fun.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10451040
text: Lost in the thrill of battle, Ban accidentally eliminates all of the Walkers. More appear, intent on capturing King.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10451050
text: Walker Queen Hark says she's been searching for King for 10 years. When she shyly confesses her love and calls him her new husband, King is so uncomfortable that he reverts to his original form.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10451051
text: Hark can't believe that King has a big form and a small form. She doesn't look like she'll back down from claiming her long sought-after husband.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10451052
text: Believing Meliodas and crew deceived her, Hark attacks, saying she won't forgive them.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10451060
text: After having finally met her love after ten years, Hark falls to Meliodas and crew. She will no longer be able to kidnap men and make them her husbands.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10452010
text: The once lush forest has turned into a gloomy marsh. Traken, the creature who tainted the forest with darkness, makes an appearance.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10452020
text: Meliodas says demonic beings called Shadows must be living in the marsh. He says the Shadows will find a new puppet and come looking for them.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10452030
text: A Shadow that had been hiding in everyone's shadows appears. It's no easy task to deal with a creature as finicky as a Shadow.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10452040
text: Since the Shadow Marsh is tainted with darkness, it won't be easy to restore. In order to fix the forest, the gang will have to burn any remaining trees and defeat all the Shadows.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10453010
text: The Fierce Dragon is openly hostile against Meliodas and crew. It's as if the dragon knows they're there to defeat it.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10453020
text: Meliodas and crew barely manage to defeat the fire-breathing Fierce Dragon. Both Meliodas and King state that something feels off.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10453030
text: All the dragons the gang defeated had one thing in common: they all understood Human language. Everyone decides to find out what's going on.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10453040
text: The dragon rider runs away after losing. Meliodas says he's heard of certain individuals who can get dragons to do their bidding, even though dragons are extremely difficult to train.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10453050
text: Meliodas speaks of those who worshipped Demons long ago. They've been assembling an army since the Demons were sealed away.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10453060
text: As he dies, the dragon rider says that there are countless Demon worshippers, and that his death won't change anything.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10454010
text: Meliodas and crew encounter an obstacle while laboriously climbing the cliffs. They must eliminate a Stone Golem to reach their destination.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10454020
text: The gang defeats the Stone Golem, but they still don't have enough Owl feathers. It looks like they need to keep climbing the cliffs for more feathers.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10454030
text: The crew comes across a flock of Huge Owls in the valley, and take the opportunity to nab their feathers. Unexpectedly, an enormous Huge Owl appears.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10454040
text: The group eliminates the Huge Owls, and gathers all the feathers they need. Meliodas says they have enough, but suggests collecting more just in case. When Ban refuses, Meliodas promises him a round of arm wresting.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10501010
text: Alan and the Armor Giant take refuge from the pouring rain in a cave. When the Armor Giant asks for a book, Alan says he'll read it for him. Meanwhile, Meliodas and crew arrive in Ordan Village and prepare to open the tavern.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10501020
text: Meliodas decides to send Elizabeth and Hawk to the village to promote the tavern and has Elizabeth try on different disguises. Really, he's more interested in seeing her in various outfits than concealing her identity.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10501030
text: After sending Hawk and Elizabeth to the village, Meliodas suggests that he, King, and Ban compete to see who can gather the best cooking ingredients. King is disinterested, but Ban's eager to begin.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10501040
text: Gowther joins the team at last! Everyone has a great time around a campfire in Ordan Village. While watching his friends enjoy their dinner, Meliodas asks Gowther about the event ten years ago and learns that Merlin was the one who knocked him out.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10501050
text: A mysterious mage suddenly appears in the Boar Hat! It's impossible to know how she got here or where he came from. The Mage abducts Elizabeth (and even Hawk) in the blink of an eye.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10501060
text: Meliodas bursts out of the tavern determined to rescue Elizabeth. Diane grabs Meliodas, Ban, and Gowther and launches them towards the capital.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10502010
text: Meliodas discovers wounded soldiers on the verge of death in the Woods of Ordan. One of them mentions the Armor Giant and the [Roars of Dawn] before dying.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10502020
text: Meliodas and crew are certain the Armor Giant is Gowther and face off against the [Roars of Dawn] to protect him. The fight is a difficult one, however, as the [Roars of Dawn] are much stronger than expected.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10502022
text: When King's "Fossilization" ability hits Hugo, Simon cuts off his arm at Hugo's behest. Jillian, the sole woman in the group, magically binds King as he reels, distracted by their shocking actions.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10502025
text: Meliodas and crew try their best to stop the [Roars of Dawn], but fail to prevent Weinheidt from firing his arrow. Meliodas tells the Armor Giant to run.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10502031
text: A figure stops the arrow with his bare hands before it reaches its target.\nHe is none other than Gowther, [b]The Goat Sin of Lust[/b].

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10502040
text: Slater tries to keep fighting, saying the [Roars of Dawn] have been ordered to take back the Armor Giant's head.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10502041
text: Gowther beheads the Armor Giant himself and hands it to Slater. Slater takes the head and leaves with the rest of the [Roars of Dawn].

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10502042
text: [The Seven Deadly Sins] greet their newest member after not having seen him for a decade. The Armor Giant they thought was dead gets back up. The beheaded Armor Giant transforms into an even more horrifying figure, posing a threat to the gang.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10502050
text: While battling the Armor Giant, Meliodas suddenly realizes his opponent is Dale, a Holy Knight of Liones he once knew.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10502060
text: Meliodas feels conflicted about killing Dale. Elizabeth tosses him Liz's sword as he weighs his options. Elizabeth's words give Meliodas newfound resolve, and he kills Dale without hesitation.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10502070
text: Dale thanks Gowther before he dies. Gowther asks him if they were friends, but the dead man speaks no more.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10550010
text: Meliodas and crew enter the forest and run into many aggressive wolves.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10550020
text: Meliodas and crew dispose of the wolves. They begin wondering who Yoos really is, perplexed that someone would come to a place like this all alone at night.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10550030
text: Meliodas and crew discover some suspicious men whispering in the forest. One of them turns out to be Yoos, the person they've been searching for.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10550031
text: Yoos's friends prevent the gang from chasing Yoos.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10550032
text: Meliodas and crew confront Yoos's friends. They discover that these men are actually Werewolves.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10550040
text: Hawk is curious why a Werewolf decided to go out with a Human. Ban takes offense when Hawk wonders if the Werewolf began the relationship to eat the Human later.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10550050
text: Meliodas and crew go after Yoos. The Werewolves have a strong defensive plan.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10550051
text: Yoos's werewolf friend, Varva, asks Meliodas to stop his pursuit. Meliodas refuses.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10550060
text: Varva tries to defend Yoos's actions, even after losing the fight. However, he doesn't have an answer when Meliodas asks what Yoos will do when the truth comes out.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10550070
text: Meliodas and crew finally find Yoos. He charges at them when he realizes that they know his secret.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10550071
text: Yoos despairs when he finds out that his lover knows the truth about him.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10550080
text: Meliodas tells Yoos that he still has a chance. Yoos says he hopes his lover will read his letter and give him a second chance.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10551011
text: The group comes across a fugitive Werewolf chased by others in hot pursuit. Meliodas decides to rescue the Werewolf.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10551020
text: The fugitive Werewolf asks for help, saying his Human friends are in trouble.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10551031
text: Luther tells his Human friends to escape. They hesitantly depart.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10551040
text: Luther says his Human friends are safe, but he fears his Werewolf friends that allowed the Humans to escape will be in danger.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10551051
text: Luther's Human friends suddenly turn up. Haku sneers when the Humans say they couldn't just leave Luther behind.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10551060
text: Haku runs away after Meliodas defeats him. Luther and his Human friends reaffirm their friendship.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10552010
text: Meliodas and crew arrive in the Forgotten Village. A kid ghost appears before them and tells them to leave immediately.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10552011
text: The kid ghost struggles with the group. He says he's going to bring his mom!

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10552020
text: The kid ghost loses his fight against the gang. He runs away crying, saying his fifteenth mother is gone.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10552030
text: The kid ghost makes another appearance. He proudly presents his nineteenth father.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10552040
text: The kid ghost disappears in tears when he loses his nineteenth father. Upon seeing this, Elizabeth says she wants to help him.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10552050
text: Meliodas and crew find the kid ghost after searching high and low, but they discover someone threatening him.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10552051
text: Confronted by the necromancer, the kid ghost asks Meliodas and crew to help him.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10552052
text: The Necromancer tells them to mind their own business and scram, but Meliodas refuses.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10552060
text: The kid ghost mourns the loss of his sixteenth mother and twentieth father. Elizabeth asks him to tell her anything he remembers about his life so she can try looking for his family.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10552070
text: Meliodas finds out that the kid ghost is the spirit of Old Hardin's dead son, and wants to tell the ghost about this.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10552080
text: Gina's spirit wails in terror. Meliodas and crew say they're not trying to harm her, but she pays them no heed and attacks.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10552090
text: When Gina learns her dead lover is still wandering the earth searching for her, she crosses over to the other side so she can meet him in the afterlife.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10552100
text: Meliodas and group search for missing children near the Forgotten Village, and discover traces of them around the cave.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10552110
text: Meliodas and crew find the children.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10553010
text: Meliodas and crew run into Werebear watchmen in the Buruka Cave as they search for Elric the Blind's long-lost lover, Illia.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10553020
text: The Werebear watchmen say Buruka used the name Illia when she was in her Human form. However, the Werebears refuse to say anything else about her.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10553030
text: Meliodas and crew discover that Buruka was the daughter of the Werebear chieftain. But before they can learn anything more, the captain of the guard appears and attacks them.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10553040
text: Meliodas learns Buruka's story. She was punished and disowned by her father for falling in love with a Human.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10554010
text: Meliodas and crew barge into Garthum's Residence. They clash with the Werebear warriors.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10554020
text: King tells Meliodas that he doesn't have to carry out Gossiper Momo's request. Meliodas says someone who's used their power to oppress is likely to do so again and that he wants to set things straight.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10554030
text: Garthum finally reveals himself when the Werebear territory is in shambles.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10554031
text: Meliodas asks if Garthum realizes how many people suffered because of his actions, but Garthum appears indifferent.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10554032
text: After seeing Meliodas's strength, Garthum asks Meliodas why he's pestering him about the past.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10554040
text: After Meliodas defeats him, Garthum admits that he regrets his actions.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10555010
text: Meliodas and crew head to the Altar of the Mountain God where they heard a strange sound and discover Mutants when they arrive.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10555020
text: Meliodas and crew eliminate the Mutants. They wonder if these creatures became Mutants by imbibing Demon blood like Dale.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10555030
text: The gang continues to exterminate Mutants near the Altar of the Mountain God.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10555040
text: Meliodas and crew wipe out all of the Mutants. Things are safe for now, but they worry whether these creatures will continue to appear.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10601010
text: [The Seven Deadly Sins] are at the Liones Castle North Gate, and Arthur Pendragon, King of Camelot, is at the South Gate. Hendrickson tries to send him back, but Arthur manages to get into the capital.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10601020
text: Thanks to Diane's efforts, Meliodas, Ban, and Gowther reach the Liones Castle North Gate in no time. They're here to rescue Elizabeth!

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10601030
text: The Holy Knights of Liones are panicking due to the breach at the North Gate. Meliodas and crew move forward as they fight. Meanwhile, Hendrickson attacks Arthur once he enters the capital.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10601040
text: The Holy Knights keep throwing themselves at [The Seven Deadly Sins], trying to prevent them from getting into the capital.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10601050
text: Meliodas and crew reach the capital safely. When they sense Hendrickson's magic coming from the south, they head in that direction. Meanwhile, Elizabeth and Hawk, who were abducted by Vivian, get locked in the Liones Castle underground prison.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10602010
text: Arthur and Hendrickson are locked in a fierce battle. Hendrickson attacks Arthur with deadly force. Just when things looked bad for Arthur, Meliodas saves him.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10602020
text: Gilthunder's attack comes with a thundercloud during the battle with Hendrickson. Meliodas manages to avert a crisis with Arthur's help.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10602040
text: Vivian answers Hendrickson's call and comes to his aid. Meliodas doesn't bother putting up a counterattack. Hendrickson is certain he's up to something, and orders his subordinates to destroy Meliodas before he carries out his plan.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10602050
text: The shockwave from the battle at Liones Castle reaches all the way to town. Diane is worried about her captain, but King says he'll be fine.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10602060
text: Meliodas destroys the creature that was watching Margaret and Hendrickson attacks Meliodas. Gilthunder blocks Hendrickson's attack.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10602070
text: When the curse on Gilthunder breaks, he attacks Hendrickson to avenge his father. Hendrickson finally falls to Gilthunder's furious assault.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10602080
text: Enraged over Gilthunder's betrayal, Vivian unleashes a magical attack and is met with a counterattack from the mysterious mage. The mage turns out to be Merlin, [b]The Boar Sin of Gluttony[/b].

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10602100
text: "Perfect Cube," a spell from the Demon realm, has sealed the king's chambers up tight. Merlin instantly removes the seal with the skill "Absolute Cancel."

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10602120
text: Dreyfus says he didn't know Hendrickson was plotting to resurrect the Demons. King Bartra strips Dreyfus of his position and has him imprisoned in the underground cells.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10602140
text: Liones Castle collapses and Meliodas quickly grabs Elizabeth to make an escape.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10603010
text: Diane is sent flying and lands in the West District. Dreyfus announces that [The Seven Deadly Sins] are invading the city, and that the people should fight them.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10603030
text: A building collapses, putting Guila's little brother Zeal in danger. Diane risks herself to protect Zeal.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10603050
text: Dreyfus is unaffected by Howzer and Guila's combined attack at full power. Gowther ends up having to rescue Guila when Dreyfus's counterattack puts her in danger.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10603060
text: Gowther learns what's happened by looking through Guila's memories. He faces off against Dreyfus.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10603070
text: Dreyfus overcomes Gowther's mental attack, and manages a counterattack of his own. He sustained quite a bit of damage from the mental attack, and vanishes after leaving Helbram in charge. Helbram attempts to land a finishing blow on Diane, but King appears and stands in his way.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10603090
text: When King tells Helbram to show his true form, Helbram reveals his Fairy form.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10603100
text: Instead of defending himself from Helbram's attack, King takes it head on. It turns out he'd been using all his magic to protect Diane.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10603120
text: Helbram falls to King's attack and finally speaks to King as though he's come to his senses. Helbram dies after handing King his helm, saying he meant to give it to King long ago.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10603130
text: Liones Castle suddenly collapses. King and crew decide to go join Meliodas. Suddenly, Guila and Jericho fall to the ground, writhing in pain.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10603140
text: After writhing in pain, Jericho transforms into a monster. Meliodas appears before the group and explains that someone is causing the Demon blood to go berserk.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10603150
text: Hendrickson reveals himself to the gang, apparently still alive. His appearance has completely changed, meaning he likely drank the blood of a Demon.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10603160
text: Meliodas and Gilthunder hesitate when Vivian takes Elizabeth and Margaret hostage, and are gravely wounded by Hendrickson's attack. This motivates Elizabeth to turn herself over to Hendrickson.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10603170
text: After reuniting, Meliodas asks Ban to help him rescue Elizabeth. Ban attacks Meliodas without warning. Ban says a Goddess told him that Elaine can be revived if he kills Meliodas.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10603180
text: Meliodas convinces Ban to put off their fight until Elizabeth has been rescued and things settle down.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10604010
text: Dreyfus appears and attacks Hendrickson. In the process, Elizabeth sustains a serious injury. Hendrickson manages to destroy Dreyfus. Meliodas shows just in time to fight Hendrickson once more.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10604050
text: Hendrickson seems to think he's invincible. Meliodas points out that demonic powers may heal wounds, but it doesn't grant immortality nor prevent him from taking damage.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10604060
text: Ban and Gowther stand back and watch the battle. Gowther piques Ban's interest when he talks about the Demon corpse, explaining that Hendrickson studied it for a long time. Ban then gets swept into the battle, gets thrown against a wall, and ends up discovering the Red Demon's corpse.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10604070
text: The impact from Hendrickson's fall reveals the Demon's corpse. The magic emanating from the corpse is identical to that of Dale and the New Generation Knights. Hendrickson says he found the corpse 20 years ago in the Fairy King's Forest, and gained its power through experimentation. Ban reveals that he's the one who killed the Red Demon.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10605020
text: Ban's attack blasts a hole in the ground and Hendrickson falls through it. All of [The Seven Deadly Sins] go after him except Diane. They discover the a Gray Demon's corpse deep within these depths. Hendrickson proceeds to take a blood sample from the corpse and injects himself with it. He begins to writhe in agony.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10605040
text: Hendrickson's appearance changes after injecting himself with the Gray Demon's blood. He transforms into a Demon, shedding his Human form entirely. The Holy Knights urge Hendrickson to surrender, but Hendrickson attacks them.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10606030
text: Exhausted by Hendrickson's relentless attacks, Meliodas is too weak to fight on. Hendrickson seizes this opportunity to inflict a final blow on Meliodas. Hawk jumps in the way of the blast, sacrificing himself to protect Meliodas and Elizabeth.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10606050
text: Hendrickson's attack leaves Hawk burnt black, unable to move. Elizabeth is overcome by grief, and her powers as the Disciple of the Goddess are awakened.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10606060
text: Elizabeth's powers heal the wounds of the Holy Knights, but the chances of defeating Hendrickson seem slim. [The Seven Deadly Sins] and Hendrickson resume battle, and Meliodas uses Gowther's "Broadcast" to relay his plan to the Holy Knights. Everyone is appalled by his plan but Meliodas pushes ahead.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10606080
text: The Holy Knights launch an assault on Hendrickson and Meliodas. Hendrickson scoffs at their indiscriminate attacks on both friend and foe.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10606090
text: Meliodas resolutely endures all of the Holy Knights's attacks.  His plan was to build up and use his "Revenge Counter." When this finally dawns on Hendrickson, he panics.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10606100
text: "Revenge Counter" hits Hendrickson and kills him but it doesn't bring Hawk back to life. Each of [The Seven Deadly Sins] share heartfelt words about Hawk. Suddenly, Hawk is miraculously reborn with a smaller body.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10607010
text: While everyone else is still passed out from last night's festivities, Elizabeth hurries to open the tavern.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10607020
text: Meliodas shares his ambitious attempt at meat pie with Gilthunder and Howzer. As always, it's totally unfit for Human consumption. Meliodas tries to figure out why his masterpiece doesn't taste like one, and wonders if the key is to use real pork... Hawk overhears him and runs from the tavern in fear.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10607030
text: Gilthunder tries his best to prevent Hawk from getting away, but he proves to be harder to capture than expected.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10607040
text: Diane, King, and Howzer set out in search of Hawk. King and Howzer are bickering when Hawk suddenly appears. The group fails to capture him again.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10607050
text: Meliodas and crew give up on finding Hawk when the sun starts to go down. To their surprise, Hawk is waiting for them at the tavern when they return, having been lured back by the smell of Ban's cooking.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10607060
text: Late at night, Meliodas is escorting Elizabeth back to the castle when she asks if he intends to go on another journey. When he answers yes, Elizabeth says she wants to go with him. Meliodas turns her down. He then proceeds to tell Elizabeth that she gives his life a sense of purpose.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10607070
text: Meliodas goes to the Trumpet of the Goddess. Angered by the Goddess's mocking words, he smashes the horn trumpet.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10607080
text: Ban heads to the Mountain Peak at the crack of dawn to keep his promise with Meliodas, but it's not just Meliodas waiting for him there. What was supposed to be a two-person match turns into another fight festival.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10607090
text: Figuring they might as well go all in if they're going to fight at all, Merlin traps Meliodas and Ban inside a "Perfect Cube." Inside, the two get ready for a showdown.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10607100
text: The glorious sight of Ban and Meliodas's ferocious fight brings Gilthunder to tears. The rest of [The Seven Deadly Sins] tell them to take the kid gloves off and get serious about their fight.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10607110
text: When his team members jeer at him for not fighting hard enough, Meliodas responds that he needs to warm up to prevent injury. Then he tells everyone except Elizabeth to pipe down and quit making a fuss.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10607120
text: King Bartra is staying at Liones Castle when he has an unexpected vision. Knowing that it signifies the return of the [Ten Commandments], he is filled with terror.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10607130
text: King and Howzer are checking out Diane when a spat breaks out between them. A crowd gathers around them, curious to see who would win in a fight between [The Seven Deadly Sins] and the Holy Knights.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10607140
text: Everyone was curious of King's fighting skills, but his actual combat abilities leave most people disappointed. Howzer wins the fight, but he still feels like he lost when he sees Diane comfort King.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10607150
text: Ban and Meliodas's fight reaches a climax. The two lose themselves in the joy of combat, almost like they've forgotten what started the fight in the first place.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10607160
text: The fight ends without a clear winner. The spectators start heading down the mountain, marveling at the skill of both fighters.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10607170
text: On a rainy night, a suspicious, hooded man lurks about, as if searching for something.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10607180
text: Diane is helping the residents of the capital. When the people express awe for her might, she reveals her identity to them. Fully expecting them to become furious upon learning her true identity, Diane is surprised when the residents apologize for judging her before even knowing who she was.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10607190
text: Diane finishes assisting the people in the capital. King subsequently appears to comfort her.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10607200
text: King and Diane are playing tag when they come across a Human wedding. They're watching the festivities when a New Generation Mutant suddenly appears and throws the wedding into chaos.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10607210
text: King and Diane deploy a joint attack to dispatch the New Generation Mutant. King catches Diane in the process, making King the winner of this round of tag.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10608010
text: Elizabeth announces that the king has decided to award [The Seven Deadly Sins] with a medal of honor. All the members of [The Seven Deadly Sins] decide to get dressed up for the occasion. Well, almost all of them.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10608020
text: Everyone is getting drunk when Ban calls Meliodas over and announces that he's leaving [The Seven Deadly Sins]. Early the next morning, King trails Ban as he's leaving. When King asks Ban where he's heading, his surprising answer is the Fairy King's Forest.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10608030
text: The medal bestowment ceremony for [The Seven Deadly Sins] goes as planned, but not everyone is in a celebratory mood. Realizing that there are dissenters among the crowd, Meliodas challenges them to speak up. Those to step forward are none other than [The Pleiades of the Azure Sky].

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10608040
text: For all of his sneering, Dogedo is brought to his knees by Meliodas before he can even make a proper attack.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10608050
text: Using Balor's Evil Eye, Hawk learns that everyone in [The Seven Deadly Sins] has a tremendously high Combat Class and falls into a panic.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10608060
text: The Trio of Troublemakers decide to track Hendrickson's movements once more. Meanwhile, Meliodas and crew sense a troubling vibration on their way back to the tavern. These vibrations cause Meliodas to realize that the [Ten Commandments] have resurrected.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10608070
text: Meliodas is astonished by what an odd couple Gowther and Guila make. In the meantime, Hawk gobbles up "something" that was on the ground.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10608080
text: Merlin is greatly agitated upon hearing the news of the [Ten Commandments]'s revival. Just as things are about to get serious, Hawk's condition suddenly deteriorates. Merlin asks what he could have eaten, and Meliodas points to a small bottle that was dropped outside. This concerns Merlin.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10609010
text: Diane and Elizabeth come to Guila with an ailing Zeal in tow, but Guila fails to recognize Zeal. She says that Gowther is the only family she has, and Diane realizes that Gowther is the cause of all of this.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10609020
text: Gowther says he used Guila to try and learn about Human emotions. Diane becomes furious upon hearing how Gowther manipulated Guila's memories, getting rid of anything that wasn't useful to him. Gowther fails to understand that he did anything wrong by replacing Guila's unhappy memories with happy ones.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10609030
text: The fight between Diane and Gowther escalates. Diane screams at a rampaging Gowther that it's unacceptable to remove someone's memories without their consent. Gowther refuses to accept this.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10609040
text: Meliodas awakens Elizabeth who had passed out due to Gowther's "Blackout." They hurriedly run to Diane and Gowther...

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10609050
text: Gowther apologizes for manipulating Guila's memories, and explains he didn't mean any harm. Surprisingly, Guila thanks him for showing her a memory of her father, even if it was just a small one. She then turns and leaves.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10609060
text: Merlin removes the powerful spell cast on Gowther and returns him to his true doll form. It turns out that Gowther is a doll created by a powerful mage from the ancient times.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10609070
text: Meliodas and crew fall into a deep discussion about Gowther's identity at the tavern. Diane feels bad for putting Gowther on the spot without knowing his story.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10609080
text: Elizabeth storms out of the tavern when Meliodas says she gets in his way. Slater goes after her and says nice things to try and make her feel better.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10609090
text: Through her Sacred Treasure, Merlin detects that strange magical forces have begun mobilizing in Camelot to the south and relocates the Boar Hat tavern to Camelot immediately.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10610010
text: The group gets together to change Merlin's mind when Gowther shows up in the tavern uniform. Surprisingly, Merlin accepts Meliodas's request, but with caveats.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10610020
text: Merlin wants him to "follow Gilthunder and discover the stalker's identity!"

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10610030
text: Gowther gets caught by Pelio while trailing Meliodas.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10610040
text: Gowther is surprised to see how sad Pelio is when he transforms into his mother. Pelio's father comes to fetch him, leaving Gowther with lingering questions.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10610050
text: Meliodas greets the Trio of Troublemakers. Just before anyone can drink the stalker's tainted tea, the stalker's presence is revealed.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10610060
text: The stalker easily deflects Meliodas's attacks. The stalker is revealed to be none other than Vivian, Merlin's apprentice.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10610070
text: Merlin asks Gilthunder to decide how to deal with Vivian. When he suggests giving her another chance, Merlin casts "Curse Engage" on Vivian.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10610080
text: Things start to heat up when Merlin becomes the tavern's newest mascot. Then Merlin storms out after Meliodas proposes something absurd to her.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10651010
text: The Holy Knights are more likely to use the Training Grounds to nap than train. Ban and Meliodas disapprove, and Gilthunder feels ashamed of his men.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10651020
text: Ban steps up to help Gilthunder deal with the lazy, unmotivated Holy Knights.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10651030
text: The Holy Knights despair in knowing that they're ineffective against powerful opponents. Ban goads them on, saying they should at least be powerful enough to protect themselves.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10651040
text: Ban successfully motivates the Holy Knights into actively training. Gilthunder thanks Ban for getting the job done.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10651050
text: Someone named Trader Moore is running a scam selling artifacts related to [The Seven Deadly Sins] at the Knights's Training Grounds. Moore flees upon spotting an oblivious Meliodas, and the Apprentice Holy Knights are furious about not getting to purchase the trader's goods.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10651060
text: The Apprentice Holy Knights become flustered when they realize they can't beat Meliodas. When one of them recognizes Meliodas, they're unable to hide their astonishment.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10652050
text: There are reports of a suspicious gang sighted in the Southern Part of Town. The group discovers some thugs intimidating a girl in a secluded part of the town where restoration efforts are almost complete.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10652060
text: Upon rescuing the girl, she tells the group that the thugs said something foreboding about offering sacrifices. The group intuits that this was no ordinary incident.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10652070
text: The thugs who tried to kidnap the girl say their great plan must not be exposed. Meliodas resolves to get answers out of these tight-lipped goons one way or another.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10652080
text: The mysterious thugs reveal themselves to be Demon worshippers. The group learns that there are large organizations of Demon worshippers scattered throughout Britannia. Meliodas is enraged by these power-hungry fanatics.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10653010
text: The rebels deem [The Seven Deadly Sins] traitors of the state, an accusation that leaves [The Seven Deadly Sins] dumbfounded.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10653020
text: Gilthunder tries to explain that this is Hendrickson and Dreyfus's doing, but the rebels refuse to accept the truth.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10653030
text: Ban wants to do away with words and kill them all. Gilthunder dissuades him, stressing that the opposing forces are still Liones Holy Knights who have mistakenly taken up arms.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10653040
text: The rebels have retreated for now, but there's no telling when they might be back. Gilthunder and Elizabeth blame themselves for this trouble. Meliodas comforts them, saying that people with false beliefs are often willing to discount the truth as lies.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10653050
text: After fleeing the Training Grounds, Moore is back to sell more junk advertised as artifacts belonging to [The Seven Deadly Sins]. Meliodas goes after him.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10653060
text: Despite his best efforts, Moore is caught by Meliodas. Meliodas confiscates all the junk Moore was selling.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10654010
text: The Watchtower is completely wrecked in the aftermath. Vivian used to keep an eye on Gilthunder and Margaret from the watchtower. The monster who would watch Margaret in Vivian's stead is still there.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10654020
text: The group discovers a nasty looking chimera that Vivian created for fun at the Watchtower.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10654030
text: Gilthunder is shocked to discover the creation of such a gruesome creature. There's no time for regret, however. This demands an immediate solution.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10654040
text: Gilthunder is relieved to have gotten the jump on the chimeras. He decides to make one last sweep to make sure there aren't any more left.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10654050
text: Vivian is forced out of hiding by Merlin. Vivian declares that things have changed in the last decade, and vows to demonstrate how much she's grown.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10654060
text: Vivian challenges her master and is subsequently put in her place. Merlin threatens to use Vivian as a test subject and she flees in terror. Meliodas thinks it's a shame that she got away, but Merlin is confident that they'll get her eventually since she won't leave the capital anyway.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10655070
text: Following traces of the young man who was once a Holy Knight, the group heads to the Mountain Peak. They find someone who fits the description and decide to help him because he's in trouble.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10655080
text: Samos is upset he lost his power as a Holy Knight. He lashes out and leaves, saying he doesn't intend to return until he regains his power. The group goes after him.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10655090
text: The group continues to follow Samos, hoping to avoid violence by changing his mind. On their way, a monster appears. It's too strong for Samos since he lost his powers, but he insists he fight it alone.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10655100
text: Samos fails to defeat the monster on his own and receives help from the group. They console Samos as he despairs over his inability to become a Holy Knight again. Samos eventually decides to go back home.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10655110
text: The group hears that Samos didn't come back home, so they set foot on the mountain path again. During their search for Samos, they run into runaway Holy Knights who give off sinister vibes.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10655120
text: The group manages to defeat the Holy Knights who had been bullying the citizens while Liones was in disarray. They learn Samos also attacked the Holy Knights a little while ago.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10655130
text: The group finds Samos fighting the corrupt Holy Knights by himself. Meliodas helps Samos, who's amazed that the group came back to find him.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10655140
text: Samos decides to take action after learning the corrupt Holy Knights are planning to attack the village once more. The group tells Samos that he has the heart of a Knight, and Samos feels like a huge weight has been lifted off of his chest.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10656010
text: Concerned for the missing children, the group arrives at the Demon's Grave in search of them. They find the children, who are oblivious to the danger.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10656020
text: After successfully rescuing the children from danger, the group advises them to stay out of trouble. Unfortunately, no one knows how seriously the children took their advice.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10656030
text: Meliodas realizes the Red-stained Stones near the Demon's Grave are the ingredient helping to create the New Generation Mutants. He heads for the Demon's Grave to dispose of them and encounters a New Generation Mutant upon his arrival.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_10657010
text: The Holy Knight says he almost died after taking medicine he bought from a suspicious Medicine Merchant, so the group heads for the North Gate. They find more New Generation Mutants and run into the Medicine Merchant they met before.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1200010
text: Legend says the Wishing Tree grants eternal love when you write your name and the name of your crush on a piece paper and tie it to the tree. Gilthunder is the most popular name on the tree.\n[Gilthunder's Guards] plot to thwart the legend.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1200020
text: The group is attacked by wolves while talking about\nhow to make Wishing Paper.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1200030
text: Hawk is startled by the wolf attack.\nMeliodas is amused by this and teases Hawk.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1200040
text: While Hawk enjoys the fragrance of distant flowers, he notices a strange movement in the corner of his eye.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1200050
text: King laughs at the beliefs of overly superstitious people. Diane complains that King doesn't understand what women want.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1200060
text: "If I can't have you, no one will!" [Gilthunder's Guards] are on the move! They obstruct everyone who approaches the Wishing Tree.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1200070
text: [Gilthunder's Guards] say they are the bulwark against lovey-dovey couples, couples with no regard for unrequited love.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1200080
text: Sonya, the enforcer of [Gilthunder's Guards], reveals her love for Gilthunder and resentment towards Margaret.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1200090
text: Sonya, the enforcer of [Gilthunder's Guards], regrets not being able to stop everyone who tries to take Gilthunder for themselves.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1200100
text: Merlin learns who created [Gilthunder's Guards]. Her name is Vivian. She's still hung up on Gilthunder and can't let go of her attachment to him.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1200110
text: Vivian flees. Elizabeth feels bad about Vivian's unrequited love. Merlin says what Vivian feels is obsession, not true love.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1200120
text: The group finally reaches the Wishing Tree, only to be interrupted by [Margaret's Guards].

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1200130
text: Full of resentment, [Margaret's Guards] flee the scene. King thinks about how hard all the drama must be for Margaret and Gilthunder.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1200140
text: It's said that the higher the Wishing Paper is tied, the better. While he tries to tie the paper to the top of the tree, King sees Howzer approaching.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1200150
text: Howzer is upset that King is getting in his way. It seems like King knows whose name Howzer wrote on the Wishing Paper.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1200160
text: Meliodas gets a paper from Elizabeth and tries to hang it on top of the tree. Ban interrupts him, however.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1200170
text: When Ban tries to interrupt Meliodas, Diane defeats him with a single strike. With all interlopers dealt with, Margaret and Gilthunder are free to tie the Wishing Paper.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_12010001
text: Ban the bandit arrives at the Fairy King's Forest to steal something. As he second-guesses whether he's come to the right place to find "the thing," a Chicken Matango appears.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_12010002
text: Ban defeats the Chicken Matango. Considering the size of it, he thinks it could be possible to find "the thing" in the forest.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_12010003
text: Fairies prevent Ban from entering the center of the forest. They say no one can pass without Harlequin's approval. Ban doesn't know who Harlequin is, so he ignores their warnings.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_12010004
text: Ban experiences more and more resistance as he approaches the center of the forest. He's more convinced than ever that "the thing" is in the forest. Suddenly, he notices a big tree in the distance.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_12010010
text: Bandit Ban arrives at the Fountain of Youth and meets a girl in front of the fountain. Ban asks her if she's lost, but she suddenly attacks him.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_12010020
text: Ban remains undefeated despite receiving multiple blows. The girl denies the possibility of the forest protecting a Human, but is still puzzled by this. She says her name is Elaine, the Guardian Saint protecting the Fountain of Youth.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_12010021
text: As Ban and Elaine start to feel a special connection, a Red Demon attacks the Fairy King's Forest.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_12010030
text: Elaine attempts to flee from the Fountain of Youth with Ban as the Red Demon attacks. Ban takes the opportunity to attack the Red Demon.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_12010040
text: Ban proudly rips out the Red Demon's heart. Unfortunately, the Demon has more than one heart, and Ban and Elaine are fatally wounded. Right before she dies, Elaine makes Ban drink from the Fountain of Youth, which grants him eternal life. Ban lashes out at the Red Demon once again, furious over losing Elaine.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_12010101
text: King suggests reaching the capital by traveling through Oslo, and Diane goes first. Oslo is unable to swallow her whole thanks to her size, so only her upper body makes it to the capital. Dreyfus and his Holy Knights appear before a flustered Diane.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_12010102
text: Diane's situation worsens as the Holy Knights' attacks continue. Determined to help Elizabeth, she courageously wields Gideon against the Holy Knights.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_12010103
text: Diane is undaunted by the Holy Knights' attacks. Finally, Dreyfus, Grandmaster of the Holy Knights, sets out to defeat Diane. Dreyfus is much more powerful than the other Holy Knights, meaning Diane's in real danger.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_12010104
text: While attacking Diane, Dreyfus asks Helbram if Elizabeth is in the capital. Helbram pretends like he doesn't know anything. Enraged by his attitude, Diane gets up to fight again. Dreyfus delivers a deadly blow.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1201020
text: King Arthur and his mage are on their way to the capital of Liones. The mage says she wants to visit her old friend Patrick, who lives nearby. Arthur says he'd like to accompany her and say hello to Patrick.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_12010200
text: Cain accidentally stops by the Boar Hat tavern and is surprised to see Elizabeth there. Cain tells her the story of Meliodas and his lover, Liz.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_12010202
text: Meliodas brings Liz home. Liz still won't lower her guard around him, but Meliodas isn't too concerned.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_12010203
text: Cain continues his story about Liz and Meliodas at the Boar Hat tavern.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_12010204
text: Meliodas says he won't use a sword because he doesn't want to kill anyone.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_12010207
text: While listening to the story of Meliodas and Liz, Elizabeth feels a strange energy coming from the Woods of Ordan. She runs to the center of the forest holding Liz's sword, concerned for Meliodas.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1201030
text: Arthur and his mage are attacked by golems on the way to Patrick's place. Arthur worries for Patrick's safety.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_12010300
text: Helbram is enraged by the memory of his friends being killed by Humans in front of him.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_12010310
text: 700 years ago, King lost his memories of being the Fairy King and befriended a young Diane.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_12010320
text: After making an outfit for Diane, King suddenly remembers the Fairy King's Forest. Diane tells King that she hopes he will continue to like her.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_12010330
text: King regains his memories in a dream. He promises Diane he will return and heads toward a burning village. King encounters an out-of-control Helbram there.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_12010340
text: Unable to control his anger for Humans, Helbram goes berserk. King decides to take responsibility by killing Helbram and erases Diane's memory.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1201040
text: A golem is on a quest to destroy all life. More interested in its structure than its purpose, the mage decides to thoroughly study the golem.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1201050
text: The golem is destroyed when the mage concludes her research. She's puzzled, as the destroyed golem emanates Patrick's magic. Using the fragments of the golem, the mage begins tracking the golem's creator.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1201060
text: The mage tracks the golem's remnants of magic and finally finds Patrick. Unfortunately, Patrick is not the friend she once knew.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1201070
text: The mage subdues Patrick but can't decide what to do with him. After thinking long and hard, she makes the difficult decision to let go of her old friend.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1201080
text: Patrick's fate has Arthur concerned about the mage. The mage tells him not to worry and insists they move forward.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1201090
text: The mage and Arthur defeat a pack of wolves that attack them out of nowhere. The mage notices Arthur is feeling down since he still can't work with magic. She tries to cheer him up.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1201100
text: The mage says they're close to the capital, but Arthur is skeptical. He thinks the mountain bandits wouldn't appear so close to the capital.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1201110
text: Arthur thinks the mage is overly protective of him. She says she'll try to worry less if her anxiety bothers him.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1201120
text: Arthur is anxious about visiting Liones since those who conquered the capital might not want to deal with them. The mage comes up with a plan. As they continue their journey to Liones, they prepare for various possibilities.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1201130
text: Arthur appears with an army at the Liones South Gate. Flustered, the two Grandmasters of the Holy Knights make several excuses to deny his entry. Since Arthur came prepared, he successfully convinces them and finally enters Liones.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_12020010
text: Escanor was born the second prince of his kingdom, but his older brother had always mistreated him out of jealously. He was shunned as a cursed being as his difference from others became apparent, forcing him to leave his own kingdom.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_12020020
text: One prince wandered alone for a long time, never confiding in anyone else. One day, he is visited by a group, a meeting that would forever change the life of the cursed prince.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_12020030
text: Bandits are getting in the way of merchants trying to pass by a small town outside the kingdom. Just when the bandits begin to steal the merchants' wares, Escanor appears.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_12020040
text: Escanor eliminates the bandit guild. The merchants who told him how to get to town ask if he wants to travel together, but Escanor refuses and leaves on his own.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_12020050
text: Escanor is making his way through a dense, foggy forest with no sunlight when Shadows appear.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_12020060
text: Sunlight begins to shine through the trees when the Shadows are defeated. Sensing that there isn't much daylight left, Escanor heads on his way again.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_12020070
text: Trolls have suddenly appeared near the town. Escanor appears before the townsfolk who are reluctant to fight the Trolls.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_12020071
text: Escanor's axe breaks apart, but weapons are not very important to him.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_12020080
text: Someone calls out to Escanor after eliminates the Trolls. Who is this person that looks like the woman who saved Escanor from the kingdom?

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300010
text: Meliodas and crew hear that Baste Prison collapsed and that its prisoners escaped. They find Cult Leader Brandon and his followers doing missionary work in a village as they discuss these events.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300020
text: Meliodas and crew defeat Cult Leader Brandon and his followers. Hawk doesn't understand how people can believe a con man like him. Meliodas replies that it's because cult religions exploit the weakest parts of the Human mind.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300030
text: Ban says that if they don't subdue Serial Arsonist Kanna as soon as possible, the entire kingdom will burn. Meliodas and crew happen upon Kanna setting things on fire before Ban can finish.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300040
text: Finally, Meliodas and crew defeat Serial Arsonist Kanna. They get the sense that Kanna's not the one controlling the fire, it's the fire that's controlling Kanna.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300050
text: Meliodas and crew set out to find the last remaining criminal, Lunatic Bao. They see a young man running and crying for help from afar. He says Lunatic Bao is going on a rampage, but Ban says that the man is Lunatic Bao.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300060
text: Learning that such a plain-looking guy could be a murderous psychopath surprises the gang. Regardless, Diane takes care of things by throwing the fugitives toward the capital.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300110
text: The dragon egg the gang picked up hatches unexpectedly, and Hawk decides to be the hatchling's parent. Hawk demands Meliodas get food for the baby dragon.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300120
text: Hawk is so happy to see the baby dragon eating well.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300130
text: The baby dragon seems lethargic, and Hawk is worried that it might be catching a cold. Hawk asks Meliodas to get some Screamer Root, which is known to be good for colds.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300140
text: After going to all the trouble of getting the Screamer Root, the baby dragon turns out to be only tired. Hawk doesn't even apologize for the inconvenience he caused everyone.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300150
text: The ground shakes and a dragon appears. The dragon looks very upset for some reason, and Hawk's afraid that it's going to hurt the baby dragon.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300160
text: The dragon turns out to be the mother of the baby dragon. The group convinces Hawk that the baby should go back to its mother. Hawk is heartbroken but also grateful for the short time he got to spend with the baby dragon.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300210
text: The Hide and Seeks lose their home in the destruction of the Forest of White Dreams and ask the gang to find them a new place to live. The group finds a place, but the Screamers living there generate a lot of noise.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300220
text: The Hide and Seeks say they can't stand the noise and ask for another place.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300230
text: Meliodas finds a new possible home. Unfortunately, it's already occupied by the Specter of Anguish.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300240
text: The Hide and Seeks say there's no way they can live with ghosts.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300250
text: Meliodas finds another place for the picky Hide and Seeks. It doesn't have problems with noises or ghosts, but it's full of spiders.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300260
text: Sick of all the spiders, the Hide and Seeks finally give up and say they'd rather go back to the Forest of White Dreams.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300310
text: After the Vaizel Fight Festival, Hawk realizes his coin pouch is gone. Hawk interrogates some petty thieves in an attempt to recoup a month's worth of income.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300320
text: The petty thieves feverishly deny Hawk's accusation. They tell him about a rumor that some thugs got a large sum of money during the festival.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300330
text: The thugs admit they got a bunch of money during the Fight Festival, but they won't explain where it came from. Hawk says he'll find out even if he has to use force, and he pesters Meliodas into doing something.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300340
text: Utterly defeated, the thugs confess the money came from some bar workers in Vaizel.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300350
text: The bar workers avoid talking about the money. They call out to some villagers and say Hawk is disrespecting them. The misinformed, angry villagers surround the group.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300360
text: The bar workers confess that Ban gave them money to seduce Meliodas. Hawk gets angry at Ban, and Ban flees the scene.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300410
text: Meliodas and crew clean the tavern for a change. Overwhelmed by the amount of trash, they accidentally throw away some high-quality Vanya Ale in the nearby swamp. Everyone is dumbfounded. Then they notice something strange flying at them.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300420
text: A Traken comes flying at the group. A marsh spirit thought they were looking for it and threw it at them.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300430
text: The marsh spirit is determined to not give up until it finds the group's missing item. The group explains what they're looking for to the marsh spirit.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300440
text: It seems like the marsh spirit has a habit of not listening to the whole story. When the group talks about adding groats to ale, the marsh spirit brings out a Screamer. Hawk explodes with frustration.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300450
text: After Elizabeth gives up describing ale to the marsh spirit, Hawk takes a stab at it. It seems to be going pretty well at first, but the phrase "Dusk Bison" causes more trouble.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300460
text: Finally, the group finishes explaining what they need. The marsh spirit finally understands, but it drinks all the ale.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300510
text: The group arrives at the site of an earlier mission. Meliodas mumbles about how Ban was uselessly intoxicated at the time.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300520
text: Meliodas says he had to beat Ban unconscious before going on a mission. Ban insists Meliodas is mistaken.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300530
text: According to Ban, they got into a fight over who'd hunted the biggest dragon while on the way to their mission.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300540
text: Ban chuckles and says he almost lost that fight. Meliodas asserts that Ban's memory is faulty.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300550
text: Diane says they're both wrong. According to her, only Diane and King went on the mission because Meliodas and Ban were late.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300560
text: Everyone argues that their account is correct, unable to come to an agreement. Even with their bickering, Elizabeth and Hawk are envious of the group's long friendship.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300610
text: Meliodas, Merlin, Gowther, King, and Ban go on a mission to eliminate a Stone Golem that appeared unexpectedly. King gets upset over Ban's selfish behaviors, like his sudden disappearances and power-stealing.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300620
text: King was put in danger because Ban took his power. King expresses his grievances, but Ban doesn't take them seriously. Enraged, King challenges Ban to a duel, invoking the fifth rule of the [The Seven Deadly Sins].

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300630
text: Ban ignores King's woes, and King wounds him fairly badly. King doesn't hold back because he knows how resilient Ban is. King's merciless attacks anger Ban and intensifies the fight.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300640
text: Gowther says Ban and King aren't going to stop fighting until one of them really gets hurt. Meliodas finally decides to get involved.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300650
text: King and Ban are upset with Meliodas and Merlin for stepping in. Meliodas says they should reconcile with a good fight without hurting each other. King and Ban are already too worked up to listen to him. It looks like the fight won't end anytime soon.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300660
text: Meliodas uses force to calm things down. He says this is where rule six, "If any team members are fighting to the death, other members must do anything they can to stop them," applies.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300710
text: Century Beach shows itself once every 100 years. It's been said that the beach is beautiful because of the treasure it holds. Everyone decides to find the treasure together when Gowther proposes a fight to thin out the competition.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300720
text: The reason Gowther was interested in the treasure is because it seemed to have the power to mesmerize people. Wanting to know what being mesmerized feels like, he declares that he won't back down even though he has lost, then disappears.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300730
text: Griamore is selling shaved ice. When he realizes that he's been recognized, he lies and says he's just a guy selling shaved ice. However, Griamore turns and challenges Meliodas to a fight when asked about the treasure.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300740
text: Griamore sheepishly grins and says he didn't want to miss out on an opportunity to spar against [The Seven Deadly Sins]. He shares a clue as an apology.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300750
text: Meliodas and crew discover Gilthunder and Howzer accompanied by a monster. The gang intuits that the monster must be controlling the two with the power of the treasure. They try to come up with a plan to snap them out of it.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300760
text: It turns out Marine Stars are quite friendly toward Humans. After things have been cleared up, they ask Gilthunder and Howzer about the treasure. The two share what they know.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300770
text: The group looks for someone who may be able to provide credible information. King, who is assumed to know about the treasure, is secretly following someone.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300780
