text: Jericho plans to take the treasure and use it on someone. Guila plans to acquire the treasure with Jericho's help and give it to someone else. The two run away from the gang.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300790
text: Merlin has already confirmed the location of the treasure when she regroups with Diane. Meliodas suggests leaving the treasure alone, but Merlin seems to have ideas of her own.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300800
text: Everyone is dumbfounded when Merlin reveals what the treasure is. They discuss what they should do about the treasure and decide to get some R&R before Century Beach disappears for another 100 years.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300810
text: [The Seven Deadly Sins] agree to help Bartra and the princesses who want to do something nice for the Holy Knights. Putting his plan into motion, Bartra dispatches Holy Knights with new armor to a mountain near Liones Castle.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300820
text: There were a few monsters, but not enough for so many Holy Knights. Ban of [The Seven Deadly Sins] appears as the group puzzles over why they were sent.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300830
text: The Holy Knights wonder why Ban would be there. Instead of a reply, Ban points over to a burning Liones. Ban says his goal is to stop them from going back.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300840
text: The Holy Knights are taken aback by the sudden battle that unfolds. Ban tells them that Liones will be in danger if they don't go back. Ban disappears after sounding like he will betray the kingdom. The Holy Knights hurriedly run after him.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300850
text: The Holy Knights come across King and Diane while pursuing Ban. They notice how awkwardly the two are acting and notice that something strange is going on. However, King's threat to burn Liones to the ground gets the Holy Knights to ready their blades.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300860
text: King and Diane disappear in the middle of the fight. The Holy Knights intuit that the two were holding back. Rather than feeling betrayed, the Holy Knights wonder why [The Seven Deadly Sins] would do this. Confused, they head down the mountain.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300870
text: The Holy Knights catch up to King and Diane. Just as they were becoming increasingly suspicious of the whole thing, Gowther appears and edits their memories. Now, they really believe they're going against rebels.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300880
text: Diane tells Gowther that things don't have to be this way, and King agrees. They decide to put the fight on hold and retreat down the mountain according to the original plan. Still under Gowther's influence, the Holy Knights chase after them.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300890
text: Meliodas, Merlin, and the rest of [The Seven Deadly Sins] are waiting at the base of the mountain. They challenge the Holy Knights to a fight, saying they won't be allowed to go back to Liones unless they win.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1300900
text: The fire at Liones Castle was an illusion created by Merlin. She reveals that it was an experiment to gather data on the Holy Knights' fighting ability at full power. She apologizes for tricking them, and tells them she'll make it up with amazing armor.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_13010000
text: The White Wave Festival is meant to commemorate the legendary King Alfred's victory in battle. Everyone had fun at the festival, but there's a bit of dispute over the details.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_13010010
text: Meliodas says he set up an obstacle course as per Bartra's orders. The people who remember it shudder at its mere mention, so it seems like Meliodas really did his best to create a difficult course.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_13010020
text: People are quite excited by the knitting event. It looks like King still can't give Diane the arm warmers he made during the event.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_13010030
text: Everyone reminisces over the last chess competition. Gowther says he won because he got lucky and was paired against incompetent players. He still doesn't know how to feel about his victory. Should he thank them for being bad at chess?

name: DB_cutscene_summary_13010040
text: People compliment Diane on her amazing powers and magic as they remember the moment she won the hut building competition. The Trio of Troublemakers can't stop laughing at their own embarrassing attempt to compete with Diane.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_13010050
text: Merlin was in charge of the magic puzzle competition as per the king's orders. She was not impressed with the Trio of Troublemakers' last performance. Everyone is determined to improve, but they're discouraged when Merlin says she's going to make the puzzle even harder this time.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_13010060
text: Hawk and Elizabeth were the winners of the eating contest. Hawk is proud he won the contest, but Elizabeth is a bit embarrassed.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_13010070
text: Ban won the cooking contest. No one could dispute that his food tasted great. The Trio of Troublemakers didn't do so well by comparison. That said, Jericho's food was even worse.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1301010
text: Elizabeth became the lead coordinator of the upcoming Fireworks Festival. It seems she wants to prepare a successful festival, but trouble always seems to find her.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1301020
text: Elizabeth recovers the stolen festival goods. A merchant named Vermil appears and tells her to hand over her role of festival coordinator.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1301030
text: Vermil made his money illicitly through the festival when Liones was in disarray. Elizabeth refuses to hand over her festival coordinator role. This time, a monster appears from an ale barrel.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1301040
text: Elizabeth claims she checked all ale barrels to make sure they were full. Vermil tries to discredit Elizabeth, but Merlin appears and confirms that the barrels indeed had ale in them.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1301050
text: Merlin says a mage has tampered with the ale barrel. After chasing Vermil, they find him arguing with a mage. It turns out that their goal was to drive Elizabeth away in order to conceal their wrongfully earned money from the festival.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1301060
text: Elizabeth says the culprits will be sent to the capital for a fair trial. Veronica wishes Elizabeth good luck in coordinating a successful festival.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1301110
text: Escanor sets out on a mission with Meliodas. The Holy Knights of Liones aren't too fond of Escanor's arrogant attitude during the daytime.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1301120
text: The Holy Knights are almost terrified of Escanor's incredible power. Just as they were comparing him to a monster, Escanor speaks up.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1301130
text: Escanor's attack barely misses the Holy Knights. He was actually aiming at a hidden straggler.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1301140
text: The Holy Knights are safe thanks to Escanor. However, all they feel is humiliation for being underrated by Escanor.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1301150
text: The Holy Knights start a fight with Escanor while Meliodas is away. Escanor can let almost anything slide, but not when someone speaks ill of Merlin.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1301160
text: The defeated Holy Knights run away, and Meliodas and Merlin return. Escanor has a strange feeling of relief from the two's words of friendship.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1301210
text: Lillia realizes she is unable to hold onto power she acquires for very long. She begins to round up people to be used as living sacrifices in order to achieve her goals.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1301220
text: Lillia has captured someone to use as a living sacrifice, but the captive Holy Knight of Liones sacrifices his own life in order to shoot a signal flare into the sky.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1301230
text: Lillia is running out of options because her pursuers are closing the gap. She won't go down so easily, however.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1301240
text: Concluding that she won't be able to run forever, Lillia decides to design a new summoning spell.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1301250
text: Lillia tries out her new summoning spell. It ends in failure, however.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1301260
text: Lillia desperately cries out that she needs an ally who shares her goals. Someone responds to her cry and appears before her.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1301270
text: The one who accepted Lillia's summoning was a girl from another world. The girl asks Lillia to prove she is powerful enough to grant her wish.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1301280
text: The girl reveals her name to be Valenti and agrees to become Lillia's ally. Valenti's wish is to see the world end, too.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1301290
text: [The Seven Deadly Sins] have found out that Lillia has summoned Valenti. Lillia looks for an escape, but it doesn't seem so easy.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1301300
text: The one who saved Lillia from danger was none other than Valenti. Having successfully escaped, the two decide to search for more allies to form [The Seven Catastrophes].

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1400010
text: Elizabeth gets seriously injured on the way to Baste Prison, and Diane decides to carry her inside her backpack. Elizabeth hopes she can be useful to her friends someday.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1400020
text: Elizabeth dreams about becoming stronger after a battle. She hopes the dream will become reality.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1400030
text: Diane says Elizabeth is able to get rid of the strange power that protects their enemies.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1400040
text: Elizabeth wakes up from her dream when the battle ends. Happy to hear that everyone returned to the village safely, Elizabeth wishes she could be strong as she was in her dream.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1400110
text: After complaining about Elizabeth's service, some customers leave without paying. This discourages Elizabeth. Hawk realizes that the customers falsely blamed Elizabeth to avoid spending money.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1400120
text: Hawk says bad customers deserve bad treatment in kind. Elizabeth is relieved to know she's not to blame for the customers leaving without paying.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1400130
text: Elizabeth and Hawk decide to promote the tavern. Unfortunately, the tavern terrible food is not well-received by the villagers.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1400140
text: It turns out Meliodas prepared the food. Hawk and Meliodas argue about this, and Elizabeth suggests that Meliodas stick to serving with her.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1400210
text: Now that the Holy Knights know the truth, they blame the masterminds and their subordinates. Gustav tries to be patient but can't stand that the New Generation Holy Knights have to endure the blame.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1400220
text: Gustav defends the New Generation Holy Knights. Unable to argue with him, the Holy Knights run away.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1400230
text: Gustav has a lot on his mind and challenges Marmas to a sparring match. He thinks fighting will help clear his head. Marmas recruits some other Holy Knight and accepts his challenge.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1400240
text: After sparring, Gustav says he regrets not being able to stop the things that have happened. He blames himself for not having more wisdom and power. Gustav is determined to get stronger and protect what matters to him. All Marmas can do is offer support.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1400310
text: Merlin encounters a Werewolf that snuck into the capital of Liones looking for her. The Werewolf attacks her, unable to believe that she is the Great Mage.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1400320
text: The Werewolf apologizes to Merlin for doubting her once she defeats him. He reveals his wish to be Human. Merlin promises to help, but she also says she'll demand something from the Werewolf one day as payment.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1400330
text: Merlin meets a suspicious merchant during a random visit to a shop. She encounters a mysterious Werewolf on her way out.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1400340
text: The Werewolf turns out to be the son-in-law of Merchant Ollie, whom Merlin helped become Human again. Merlin agrees to find a way to help him become Human but asks for a specific payment in return.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1400410
text: Hendrickson is often absent from external missions. Rumors begin circulating among the soldiers that Hendrickson's weakness can be found in a secret area at the Black Magic Research Hall. Furthermore, the soldiers mock those who are preparing diligently for the Holy War. At that moment, Hendrickson appears.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1400420
text: Hendrickson says he can forgive their impression of him, but cannot forgive the statements ridiculing Holy Knights who are preparing for the Holy War.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1400430
text: As more and more people begin to question Hendrickson's disappearances, some Holy Knights decide to try tailing him. Hendrickson does not make it easy, however.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1400440
text: Hendrickson tells the Holy Knights gathered at the Training Grounds that he welcomes all suspicion. He then confidently reveals his plans.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1400510
text: Helbram gets involved in a fight against a thug hassling a merchant at the entrance to the village.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1400520
text: A child is almost hit by a wagon as a result of the fighting and Helbram is unable to prevent it. The child is saved by a passerby.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1400530
text: Helbram meets a man in a forest overrun with poisonous spiders. Helbram eliminates a swarm of poisonous spiders that appear.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1400540
text: Helbram can't understand why someone would risk their life for paint. The man replies that it's because he wants the world to remember him.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1400610
text: Dreyfus tells his exhausted Holy Knights that anyone who can win against him in a sparring match will be granted extended vacation days.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1400620
text: None of the Holy Knights won the sparring match, but one Holy Knight mentions Griamore and says he wants to play with his child, even for a day. Dreyfus decides to give them vacation days.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1400630
text: Dreyfus goes shopping to make young Griamore a special meal when he sees a child about to be kidnapped. He steps in to take care of it.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1400640
text: Dreyfus comes across a lead that could help clear out the bandit guild, but feels conflicted because he promised to spend time with Griamore.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1400710
text: Ban is on his way to buy ale made with wild berries from the Fairy King's Forest. He fights against some Matango for a nice beer snack.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1400720
text: Ban whips up a snack with the Matango to pair with the ale. He excitedly buys ale made with wild berries from the Fairy King's Forest.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1400730
text: In an unfamiliar town, Ban looks for a shortcut to the Fairy King's Forest. Only concerned with how fast he can get there, Ban is faced with a group of bandits.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1400740
text: Ban refuses their offer to get the ale he wants and heads toward the Fairy King's Forest, saying there's something more important than ale.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1401110
text: A region of Camelot is experiencing an outbreak of a contagious disease, and Arthur takes it upon himself to prevent it from spreading. With Merlin's help, he finds the source of the disease, a cursed bat, and kills it.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1401120
text: Arthur is highly praised for taking care of the problem, but he is unable to determine where the curse came from. Merlin predicts that Arthur's journey will be met with many twists and turns.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1401130
text: Arthur has read through all sword art textbooks, but feels that real combat is the best way to learn. Merlin summons an ancient knight for him to spar.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1401140
text: Merlin is astonished by Arthur's ability to learn and use an ancient sword art just by experiencing it in person.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1401210
text: On their way back from grocery shopping, Hawk and Elizabeth come across catcalling hoodlums. Though afraid, Elizabeth makes a courageous stand.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1401220
text: After returning to the tavern, Hawk tells everyone what happened. Everyone consoles the clumsy Elizabeth.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1401230
text: In order to train Elizabeth, Hawk heads toward a hill inhabited by wolves.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1401240
text: Hawk is disappointed when Elizabeth befriends the wolves, but she seems to have gained confidence from it.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1401310
text: Elaine finds Fairy King Harlequin who spends his time watching Humans. She resolves that she must make up for her brother's absentmindedness.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1401320
text: Harlequin tells Elaine not to worry about the forest when he's around. However, Elaine is unable to shake the feeling that something will go wrong.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1401330
text: Elaine endlessly waits for Harlequin's return to the Fairy King's Forest. Barbarians seeking to steal from the Fountain of Youth appear before Elaine who is determined to protect the forest at all costs.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1401340
text: Elaine has protected the forest in place of the Fairy King. Though afraid, she resolves to protect the forest until Harlequin returns. Doubt and loneliness linger in her heart, however.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1401410
text: Ban is busy looking for a way to revive the dead even while he's on a mission with [The Seven Deadly Sins]. A Medicine Merchant selling potions that revive the dead approaches him. The merchant says he's out and can't sell him one, however.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1401420
text: Ban easily finds all the necessary ingredients which the Medicine Merchant thought would be impossible to find. Ban suddenly takes the merchant somewhere after receiving the potion.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1401430
text: Ban heads to the graveyard with the Medicine Merchant in tow. Ban pours the potion on a grave to test its effects. A skeleton rises from the grave, however.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1401440
text: Ban leaves the Medicine Merchant in the graveyard with the skeletons. Meliodas appears when Ban is tormented by the idea that it may be impossible to resurrect Elaine. Ban leaves to have a drink and ease the pain with Meliodas.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1401510
text: Diane is given an order to stay put in the forest as part of the gang's mission, but she desperately wants to accomplish the mission together with Meliodas. Suddenly, a swarm of insects appears before Diane, who absolutely hates bugs.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1401520
text: Diane succeeded in driving the insects away, but she caused a ruckus that could be heard by everyone nearby. Fearing that she may have put Meliodas in danger, Diane hurries down the mountain.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1401530
text: When Diane reaches the bottom of the mountain, barbarians block her path. She tries to play it cool in order to get to Meliodas, but they don't seem that gullible.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1401540
text: Diane defeats the barbarian soldiers and gets ready to look for Meliodas. Meanwhile, Meliodas has already finished the mission and comes back to join Diane.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1401710
text: Escanor, who had been running the tavern My Sweet Gluttony, happens to hear a rumor about Merlin. When he goes to look for her, all he finds are wandering barbarians.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1401720
text: When Escanor asks the wandering barbarian chieftain if he has seen Merlin, he responds that he had heard a rumor about her in the past.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1401730
text: The barbarian chieftain's claim of hearing rumors of Merlin was a lie. With more allies in tow, he prepares to attack Escanor.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1401740
text: Despite their number, the barbarians were no match for Escanor. Looking forward to the day he will see Merlin again, Escanor heads back to his tavern.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1500210
text: Some Liones Knights are supposed to be heading to a local village, but they seem to be endlessly wandering the surrounding forest. Meanwhile, [The Seven Deadly Sins] end up fighting some Holy Knights that insult them in the Training Grounds.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1500220
text: In order to test [The Seven Deadly Sins], Bartra asks them to prove themselves by solving a problem in a village.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1500230
text: Meliodas, King, Diane, and Merlin head to the village to prove they can handle Bartra's test. On their way, they discover some ordinary monsters in the forest.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1500240
text: Diane doesn't think these monsters could be the problem, but Meliodas says they didn't seem as ordinary as she thinks.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1500250
text: Shrouded in dense fog, the group keeps going in circles through the forest. Merlin starts to seem increasingly suspicious to King.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1500260
text: The group runs into some locals from the village they're heading to. Though many villagers have gone missing, they insist things are fine. The group finds this suspicious.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1500270
text: The villagers think [The Seven Deadly Sins] are Holy Knights and are excited to see them in the village. A monster suddenly appears, and the group decides to eliminate it for the villagers' safety.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1500280
text: To thank the group for defeating the monster, the villagers treat them to an extravagant meal. While everyone is enjoying the feast, King notices Merlin isn't touching any of it.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1500290
text: Meliodas and Diane suddenly start staggering, and many others begin acting strangely as well. King asks Merlin if she's done something to them.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1500300
text: Merlin says she's been observing everyone because there's something strange going on. She tells King that their strange behavior is caused by the effects of a poisonous plant.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1500310
text: King and Merlin walk up the forest path. They find a Death Whisper blooming poisonous flowers that resemble medicinal ones near a water source.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1500320
text: King and Merlin get rid of all the poisonous plants. On their way back to the village, they run into the missing Liones Holy Knights and Apprentice Holy Knights.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1500330
text: King and Merlin realize the Knights have also been poisoned. The villagers act as if they are possessed and attack them along with the Knights. Not wanting to hurt any innocents, Merlin asks King to subdue them while she acquires an antidote.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1500340
text: King fights desperately until Merlin returns. Merlin finally appears with the antidote and resolves the crisis.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1500350
text: Back in the village, King and Merlin find Meliodas and Diane up and about causing a ruckus. They struggle to make them take the antidote.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_1500360
text: The group solves the village's problems and returns to Liones, where Bartra gives them praise. Merlin asks Bartra to reimburse her for the cost of making the antidote and leaves the castle.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_2002010
text: The Hide and Seeks are angry that the forest was destroyed during Meliodas and Gilthunder's fight. Seeking revenge, they disguise themselves as Gilthunder.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_2002020
text: Upon entering the Fortress of Outlaws, the group suddenly feels weak and drowsy. Their state is the result of a hypnotic scent intended to control criminals. They even start to see illusions.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_2002030
text: The Crystal Cave is where souls stop before heading to the Capital of the Dead. The group meets Jude of the [Weird Fangs], whom Ban killed.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_2002040
text: It's said that a powerful sandstorm comes to Vaizel when a red moon rises. The sandstorm is known to create illusions like a desert mirage.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_2002050
text: The Woods of Ordan are covered in the Armor Giant's blood after an intense fight. Tainted by the blood, the Mountain God of the Woods of Ordan goes insane.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_2002060
text: Fierce fights often leave illusions in their wake. The illusions here are full of negative energy, probably due to the effects of the Demon corpse.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_2003010
text: When the strange matter wandering around the Temple of Belenus attacked King, it turned into a copy of him. Unlike Merlin who is intrigued, King doesn't seem too pleased. They decide to eliminate the shapeshifting matter before the temple reinforces it.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_2003020
text: It seems Gowther wants to see himself from an outside perspective. He attacks the strange matter on purpose to create a copy of himself. He expects it to have his appearance and magic, but...

name: DB_cutscene_summary_2003030
text: Merlin is planning on an experiment to create a being more powerful than herself using the Final Boss. Merlin seems excited to run her tests, but the group begins to fear the aftermath her success may bring.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_2004010
text: The Demonic Beast Purinpu appears in the ruins of Britannia. Purinpu wishes to turn everything it touches into ruins. The first to notice Purinpu's presence, Merlin summons the other members of [The Seven Deadly Sins] after concluding that she will need some help.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20701010
text: The giant weapon Albion launches a surprise attack on Camelot. While the knights prepare for battle under Arthur's orders, a floating Boar Hat tavern catches their attention.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20701020
text: The Albion suddenly attacks in the direction of Camelot, but Merlin's barrier successfully protects the area.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20701030
text: Merlin's barrier is overwhelmed by the continuous attacks. The Albion must be eliminated before Camelot is destroyed.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20701040
text: The Albion that was attacking Camelot is quickly destroyed. With the help of Merlin's teleportation magic, Meliodas's attack had landed a direct hit.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20701050
text: The Albion's weakness is its core hidden in its torso. Meliodas takes the opportunity and climbs the body of the Albion.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20701060
text: Meliodas makes a move in order to save Arthur, who is in trouble. He succeeds, but his sword is broken.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20701070
text: Merlin hands something over to Meliodas, whose sword had snapped. It is the Sacred Treasure Lostvayne which Meliodas had sold off. He attacks Albion, reinforced by the power of his Sacred Treasure.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20701080
text: An Albion has five horns on its body. Each horn accumulates power, allowing them all to attack simultaneously. As it becomes impossible to fight the monster alone, Meliodas suddenly splits into five.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20702000
text: Ban and King leave Liones and find Jericho, who had been trying to follow them incognito.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20702010
text: Ban, King, and Jericho set foot in the Fairy King's Forest after traversing a foggy area. However, the Fairies there are cold towards King, calling Ban the Fairy King instead. King runs away, and Ban tells the Fairies that he's not fit to be their king.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20702011
text: King doesn't have the courage to look at Elaine. When he began crying with his helmet on, Helbram's spirit appears and consoles him.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20702020
text: According to Ban, Diane revealed her feelings for King on the morning of the festival. Before King could go back to Diane, the forest begins to grow rapidly.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20702021
text: Gerharde expresses gratitude to Ban for making the forest grow. However, she mentions that Ban is nothing more than nutrients for the forest, and attacks.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20702030
text: Ban defeats Gerharde and declares that he's leaving the forest. Unable to accept, Gerharde attacks Elaine.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20702040
text: Albion, a monster larger than the Fairy King's Great Tree, attacks the forest. The Fairies fear they will lose their home once again. Jericho hurries toward Ban to tell him.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20702050
text: Upon entering Elaine's chamber, Jericho finds Ban bound by Gerharde and forced to revitalize the forest. Jericho is enraged, but Gerharde ignores her and asks Puora why he came.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20702060
text: King tries to stop the Albion on his own. The Fairies are moved by King's efforts to protect the forest despite sustaining heavy damage. Gerharde and the Fairies try to evacuate King, but he does not back down.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20702070
text: King successfully defeats the Albion. Ban gives his blood to king in order to heal him. As the Fairies come to accept King as the Fairy King, Ban and Jericho leave the Fairy King's Forest.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20703010
text: When Elizabeth is discouraged because she isn't helpful to Meliodas, Slater cheers her up. Suddenly, Galland appears in Camelot with a thunderous sound.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20703030
text: Galland destroys a town in Camelot in the blink of an eye, turning it into an empty field. Meliodas moves to stop Galland, but it's no use. Surprised by the difference in strength, Merlin teleports Galland to a different location in order to come up with a different strategy.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20703050
text: Merlin tries to negotiate with Galland by lying, but her deception is quickly exposed by Galland's commandment of [b]Truth[/b]. Merlin turns to stone due to the curse.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20703070
text: Meliodas musters all his strength to keep himself from being consumed by the power, but it is not enough to stop Galland. Aside from those who were protected by Merlin's "Perfect Cube," everyone takes considerable damage.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20704010
text: Meliodas, who had been dreaming of Liz, is awakened by Elizabeth's worried tears. It appears that he had been moved to Camelot Castle and had been receiving treatment. Merlin's body is still made of stone, however.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20704020
text: Not even Merlin's magic can nullify the powers of [The Ten Commandments] because it was granted by the Demon King himself. Merlin, whose soul is now inside Morning Star Aldan, says that the group must become stronger in order to defeat them.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20704030
text: The group is on their way to Diane when they run into King, who traveled using Oslo. King finds Diane as soon as he arrives, but Diane doesn't remember him.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20704050
text: King gives Gowther a good smack in the face before announcing that he'll go after Diane. However, King wasn't the only one who wanted to go after Diane.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20705010
text: King asks Merlin to teleport him in order to get to Diane faster. Merlin refuses, however, saying she'd prefer to save her energy in case things go awry.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20706010
text: A Red Demon appears and begins devouring the souls of the people around him. The Trio of Troublemakers step in to stop him.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20706020
text: The Trio of Troublemakers defeat the Red Demon and the stolen souls are returned to their rightful owners.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20706030
text: Another Demon appears along with Hendrickson. He asks for everyone's help in defeating the Gray Demon.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20706040
text: Hendrickson tells the true story of what's been happening so far. The Demon that plotted all of this is currently in Dreyfus's body.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20707010
text: Her memories fading, Diane remembers the times when she used to live with other Giants in Megadozer. She remembered the time she stood alongside the warrior chief Matrona and her friend Dolores in battle.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20707020
text: The Giants head back to town after collecting their payment. Matrona scolds the two Giants for not being aggressive in combat.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20707030
text: Dolores wants to leave her home, but speculates that no village would accept her. Diane meets Meliodas when she leaves town on her own and is overjoyed by the fact that there are others who can accept Giants. What awaited Diane back home was the news of Dolores's death in battle.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20707040
text: Diane wants to avoid unnecessary fighting while Matrona sees it as a way of life, and the two clash over their differences. Diane wishes that she could tell someone about her hopes and dreams.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20707050
text: Diane and Matrona are once again fighting for Humans as mercenaries. It turns out to be a trap set by the Humans to kill the Giants and make a name for themselves.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20707060
text: The Humans use poison to bring down the Giants. Matrona gets hit with a poisoned dart while protecting Diane and collapses. Matrona massacres the Humans until the very moment she collapses. The Humans make a false report and frame Diane.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20707070
text: Galland goes out for a walk after informing [The Ten Commandments] of Meliodas's death. He is puzzled when he sees Diane, whom he thought he had killed, alive and well.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20707080
text: Galland asks Diane how she could be alive. Diane doesn't remember him, however, and is only confused and afraid.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20707090
text: [The Ten Commandments] are interrupted just as they're about to attack Diane. Diane is bewildered when she sees that it was Matrona who saved her. Meliodas and crew sense a new power while heading for Diane and decide to stop and assess the situation.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20707100
text: Sensing Meliodas's presence, Monspeet fires his "Hell's Phoenix" in the gang's direction. Right when Meliodas was about to counter it, Hawk's Mama swallows the "Hell's Phoenix" whole. Matrona takes the opportunity to take Diane away from [The Ten Commandments].

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20708010
text: Meliodas and crew arrive at the Druid Holy Grounds, Istal.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20801000
text: Meliodas and crew are greeted by the leaders of the Druids and a priest. Hawk is shocked to learn that Jenna and Zaneri are the leaders, not Theo.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20801010
text: Meliodas and crew safely finish their training. Zaneri takes Meliodas and Elizabeth to the Tower of Trials on the right.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20801011
text: Meliodas and Elizabeth enter the Tower of Trials. Zaneri tells the two who are placed in an unfamiliar environment to prepare themselves for a test.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20801020
text: Meliodas must endure Zaneri's test. Meliodas opens his eyes to find himself in Danafor, the kingdom which vanished 16 years ago.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20802010
text: Meliodas meets Liz, but he can't figure out Zaneri's intentions. Just then, Liz dies right in front of Meliodas. As he begins to lose himself to wrath, time reverts itself. Meliodas realizes the meaning of this test.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20802020
text: Though Meliodas knows that he must move on from Liz to pass the test, he also knows that to be impossible. He loses himself to wrath and suffers.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20802030
text: Unable to control his emotions, Meliodas suffers in pain. Zaneri tries to stop the test, but Elizabeth urges her to wait for him.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20802040
text: Elizabeth wants to trust Meliodas and wait for him. Meliodas is happy to be with Liz during the test.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20802050
text: Though tormented by the pain of losing Liz, Meliodas tries to end the cycle of saying goodbye. Meliodas is greeted by Elizabeth when he finally passes the test, shocking Zaneri.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20803010
text: The Trio of Troublemakers were beaten and tattered. Gilthunder thanks Hawk. With enough people ready to go, Jenna tries to start the training, but King refuses.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20803020
text: Hawk enters the Training Grotto. Meanwhile, Gilthunder and Howzer are paired up again.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20803021
text: A Clay Dragon appears as soon as an Amber is selected. Gilthunder and Howzer start unleashing a flurry of attacks.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20803030
text: Howzer and Gilthunder are struggling in the Training Grotto. They start bickering over their differences in fighting styles.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20803040
text: Gilthunder and Howzer won't stop quibbling. They recall a time when they were scolded by Meliodas and Dreyfus.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20803050
text: Despite failing to take down the Clay Dragon, both Gilthunder and Howzer have become more powerful. Hendrickson looks on.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20803060
text: Arthur and Gowther take on the Golem Soldier. It's a surprisingly tough fight.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20803070
text: Meliodas asks King in the Training Grotto if he can forgive Hendrickson. King can't understand Meliodas, and even begins to think he is being suspicious.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20803080
text: Meliodas and King suddenly get into a fight. Jenna and Gilthunder are confused.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20803090
text: Meliodas won't give a straight answer. King uses magic against him.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20803100
text: King asks Meliodas if he's a member of the Demon race. Meliodas retorts, questioning how one can be a Fairy King without wings. Before the fight gets too out of hand, Jenna stops them.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20803110
text: Having passed the test, Meliodas receives his power back from Jenna.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20804010
text: Meliodas arrives at Edinburgh where [The Ten Commandments] are located.\nGalland steps forward to challenge him.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20804020
text: This time, with his powers back, Meliodas doesn't lose against Galland.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20804030
text: When Jenna asks if Meliodas really let go of his emotions, Zaneri replies that he has not.\nHe is keeping his emotions under control.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20804040
text: After declaring war against [The Ten Commandments], Meliodas returns to Istal.\nWhile the [The Ten Commandments] have spread out all over Britannia to take control, a suspicious visitor arrives where Vaizel Arena used to be.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20805010
text: Ban and Jericho arrive at Ravens.\nAs they are about to have a conversation at the old inn, a strange sound is heard from outside.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20805020
text: As the old Werefox begins to speak, Ban's past is revealed.\nBan used to steal food to survive as a young boy when he met a thief named Zhivago.\nThough the two scrounged to survive, they relied on and helped each other.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20805030
text: The Werefox begins to tell his story of how he lost both of his sons.\nBan says he never resented the remorseful Werefox, and reveals that he is Zhivago's son.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20805040
text: Zhivago is happy to see that Ban grew up to be a fine young man.\nBan tells him his worries, and Zhivago gives one last bit of advice.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20806010
text: Having completed their training, Meliodas and crew part ways with Jenna and head on their way.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20806011
text: After the group leaves Istal, Jenna and Zaneri talk about Meliodas's reasons for protecting her.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20806020
text: Melascula's power causes a strange phenomenon where dead bodies are coming back to life throughout the town.\nMeanwhile, a similarly ominous event occurs in the Fairy King's Forest.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20901010
text: There's an ominous energy flowing through the Fairy King's Forest. Elaine, the saint of the Fairy King's Forest, comes back to life.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20901020
text: Elaine suddenly attacks the Fairies for having acted friendly toward Ban.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20901030
text: Elaine attacks Gerharde for hurting her one and only Ban.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20901040
text: The resurrected Elaine calls for Oslo. Meanwhile, King hears from Helbram that the dead are coming back to life.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20902010
text: Elaine appears before Ban and Jericho, who had been moving the corpses. Ban and Elaine are happy to be reunited. Meanwhile, the unnamed owner of the tavern in the cave senses that something has gone awry.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20902020
text: Under someone else's control, Elaine attacks Jericho. Ban tries to stop her, but Elaine begins to attack him as well.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20902030
text: Jericho blurts out her true feelings while telling Elaine off for attacking someone she loves. Elaine comes back to her senses, but is unable to keep her power under control. At that moment, Ban embraces Elaine and promises her his eternity.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20902040
text: Galland and Melascula are intrigued by Ban's magical power. Ban uses his power, "Hunter Fest."

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20902050
text: Ban overwhelms Galland with his "Hunter Fest."

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20902060
text: Melascula figures out the weakness of "Hunter Fest" and traps Ban with "Gloom Cocoon."

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20902070
text: Galland swipes Ban's soul that Melascula extracted. Ban reappears before the mourning Elaine and Jericho. It turns out that Zhivago gave his life to save his son.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20902080
text: Galland and Melascula are taken aback when their hearts were pulled out in an instant. However, they realize that they are still at an advantage and collect themselves.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20903010
text: Arden and Deldry are tailing Dreyfus, who arrived in the mining town, Ferzen. They carry out their orders in the name of [The Pleiades of the Azure Sky].

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20903020
text: Disguised, Deldry approaches Dreyfus and kisses him while his guard is down to taunt him.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20903030
text: Dreyfus punches his own face instead of Deldry's. This is due to Deldry's magical ability, "Love Drive."

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20903040
text: Dreyfus tries to free himself from Deldry's spell to no avail. At that moment, an arrow is shot in their direction and Dreyfus protects Deldry with his body.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20903050
text: Deldry kisses Dreyfus once again, saying that the magic hasn't affected him enough. Arden charges his weapon with magic and hurls it at Dreyfus.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20903060
text: Waillo jumps into the fight between Dreyfus and Arden.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20903070
text: [The Pleiades of the Azure Sky] manage to capture Dreyfus. Waillo constantly asks Deldry to marry him.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20904010
text: Carrying Ban and Elaine on her back, Jericho runs away from [The Ten Commandments] as fast as she can. At that moment, a boulder flies toward them.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20904020
text: Jericho moves Ban and Elaine to a safe location and blocks the boulder thrown by Galland head on, injuring her greatly. Ban and Elaine tell her to run on without them, but Jericho won't give up. She summons the last bit of strength she has remaining and hides everyone in a cave. What awaited them there was a tavern called My Sweet Gluttony, run by a man whose name is not yet known.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20905010
text: Jericho summons the last bit of strength she has remaining and hides everyone in a cave. What awaited them there was a tavern called My Sweet Gluttony, run by a man whose name is not yet known.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20905011
text: Galland and Melascula manage to find the tavern. Enamored by the tavern's fantastic ale, they put their pursuit of Ban aside and suggest a round of Galland Game.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20905020
text: Galland explains the rules to his game and threatens to kill everyone if they refuse to play. The tavern owner reluctantly agrees to play the game, but temporarily faints from Galland's prank. The tavern owner awakens the next day, revealing himself to be the final member of [The Seven Deadly Sins], Escanor, who possesses the power "Sunshine."

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20905030
text: Escanor displays his overwhelming strength against Galland. Melascula is surprised to see a Human this strong.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20905040
text: Galland uses his "Critical Over." He raises his Combat Class to 40,000 and attacks Escanor.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20905050
text: My Sweet Gluttony is destroyed by Galland's attack, but there's not even a scratch on Escanor. When Escanor raises his Sacred Treasure to attack, Galland tries to run away but is turned to stone by his own Commandment.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20905060
text: Melascula disregards Escanor's words and begins to cast "Gloom Cocoon."

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20905070
text: Melascula eats Escanor's soul, but soon collapses with the agony of being set on fire. Ban introduces Escanor, shrunken in size at night, to the gang. At that moment, Oslo and King find their way to the group.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20906010
text: Denzel stabs the restrained Dreyfus with a sword. He says it's all for the greater good.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20906020
text: Under Denzel's power, "Dead Man's Revenge," Dreyfus is attacked by those he killed, beginning with the [Roars of Dawn].

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20906030
text: Dreyfus is unable to begin his attacks due to Deathpierce's magical power and attempts to escape.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20906040
text: Dreyfus fails to escape due to the "Perfect Cube."

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20906050
text: Taking Dogedo's form, Grayroad appears before Deldry's group waiting outside. Deldry hands him the Spell Bead and the "Perfect Cube" is removed. Grayroad reveals his true identity.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20906060
text: Denzel and Deathpierce become powerless before Grayroad's Commandment. Before leaving the tower, Dreyfus gives Deathpierce a word of warning.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20906070
text: Deldry's group notices Dreyfus walking out from the tower. Realizing that Deldry's magic has been removed, Dreyfus charges at her.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20906080
text: Dreyfus stabs Deldry with a sword. Before he leaves, Dreyfus reveals that he is a substitute member of [The Ten Commandments] and that Gowther was the original member.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20907010
text: Matrona suggests becoming a dancer to Diane, who had lost her memories.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20907020
text: Matrona teaches Diane how to dance. In the midst of her practice, Diane feels an ominous energy, revealed to be from a Blue Demon. Under Gloxinia's command, the Blue Demon had been spreading flyers for the Great Fight Festival in Vaizel. It attacks Sol and Della, who were playing by the riverside.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20907030
text: In order to save the children, Matrona decides to participate in the Great Fight Festival. Diane decides to join her.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20908010
text: Meliodas and crew get their hands on a flyer for the Great Fight Festival. They immediately head for Vaizel.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_20908020
text: Matrona and Diane head toward Vaizel. Meanwhile, Escanor's group is also heading to Vaizel.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3001001
text: Elizabeth asks Meliodas what kind of sins [The Seven Deadly Sins] committed 10 years ago. Meliodas laughs and avoids answering.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3001010
text: The villagers of Vanya blame Mead for offending a Holy Knight. Flustered, Mead flees the scene.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3001011
text: Meliodas wants to ask what Mead meant when he said [The Seven Deadly Sins] were his friends, but Mead says he's hungry and needs to eat first.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3001012
text: After gathering some ingredients, Meliodas prepares to make food for Mead. Hawk doesn't seem too happy about it.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3001020
text: Mead says he put a bug in a Holy Knight's ale because the Knight insulted the villagers who raised him when he was orphaned. He says he didn't expect it to cause trouble. He runs to the village when he hears a commotion.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3001030
text: While drinking Vanya Ale, Gilthunder's underlings laugh at the villagers trying to pull out his sword. Meliodas takes their ale and drinks it. He says he can't pay for it, but he'll repay them another way.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3001040
text: The villagers are ecstatic when Meliodas pulls out Gilthunder's sword and decide to throw a party at the Boar Hat tavern.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3001050
text: Elizabeth gets discouraged by her mistakes and runs out of the tavern. Meliodas pretends like he's going to the bathroom and follows her.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3001060
text: After throwing Gilthunder's spear back, Meliodas suggests leaving Vanya and going to the Forest of White Dreams.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3002000
text: Meliodas and crew decide to go to Baste Prison to get Ban first.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3002010
text: A village appears in the distance. Elizabeth rushes Hawk, saying they need to find a doctor in the village to treat Meliodas.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3002020
text: Diane rejects Elizabeth's request to join the trip to Baste Prison and lashes out at her. Suddenly, poisonous insects from the prison swarm and attack Dalmally.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3002030
text: Thanks to Diane, the poisonous insects are eliminated. Elizabeth and Hawk go back to Dr. Dana's house to check on Meliodas.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3002040
text: Meliodas wakes up looking no different from usual. His wounds are completely healed as well. Hawk chases after the people who caused all this trouble, Dr. Dana and Golgius.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3002050
text: Golgius disappears, but Hawk says he can track his scent. Meliodas plans to attack Golgius when he reveals himself.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3002060
text: Meliodas lures Golgius to an abandoned house and interrogates him.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3002070
text: Hawk and Meliodas are ready to go to Baste Prison, but Elizabeth runs to Dr. Dana.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3002080
text: Elizabeth shows Meliodas the backpack she fixed. They head toward Baste Prison together.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3002090
text: Meliodas and Ban had enough of their reunion battle and decide to go back to Dalmally.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3002100
text: Elizabeth asks for Ban and Sennett as soon as she wakes up, and Diane tells her they found both of them.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3002101
text: Dalmally is ravaged, and Elizabeth feels bad leaving the village behind. Meliodas and crew decide to stay and help rebuild the village before leaving.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3002102
text: Diane declares she will clear the stone pillars, saying it's her responsibility.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3002103
text: Sennett requests that the villagers' needs and concerns be identified and resolved in person.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3002104
text: The villagers of Dalmally express their gratitude to Meliodas and crew, who insist on finishing up the remaining tasks left in Dalmally themselves.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3002105
text: Elizabeth still seems concerned about the Dalmally villagers.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3002110
text: The next stop is the Capital of the Dead where King supposedly located. There's no way to tell what it's like, but the gang decides to head over anyway since they don't have any other leads.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3003000
text: Ban slips away while Meliodas is delegating jobs and runs into a girl bearing a strong resemblance to Elaine. At that moment, she collapses before his eyes.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3003010
text: A mysterious boy is hostile towards Ban for some reason.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3003011
text: A boy suddenly appears before Ban. He seems to harbor a deep resentment for Ban.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3003020
text: Ban wants Meliodas to gather some cooking ingredients so he can feed the hungry siblings a decent meal.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3003030
text: Ellen explains that cherished memories of the dead will help reveal the path to the Capital of the Dead, but Meliodas and crew are confused how this is supposed to work.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3003040
text: The path to the Capital of the Dead is revealed. Everyone has their own ideas about how it may have opened up, but no one knows for sure.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3003050
text: Meliodas and crew find themselves back in Post Town Tala. They decide to go back to the tavern to dress their wounds and sit down for a hot meal.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3003060
text: A very hungry Hawk clamors to be fed. Since there's no time or ingredients available for a decent meal, the group decides to make do with a makeshift dinner.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3003070
text: King is upset with Meliodas for selling his Sacred Treasure while the capital of Liones is dealing with the emergence of the New Generation. Meliodas decides to start gathering information on the Sacred Treasure.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3003071
text: The group is ready to begin their travels, but they aren't sure where they should head. They decide to continue running their business while they gather more intel.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3003080
text: A tavern visitor describes hearing about a massive hammer that no one can wield. It sounds a lot like Diane's Sacred Treasure. Meliodas and crew decide to go to Vaizel to see for themselves.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3004000
text: Vaizel is bustling with activity. Meliodas and crew decide to look around the village to see what they can learn about the Sacred Treasure.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3004010
text: A mysterious old man by the name of Cain informs Meliodas that the giant hammer is located behind the arena. He says the hammer is the Fight Festival's grand prize.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3004020
text: The Vaizel Fight Festival tryouts have finally begun. The judge, Love Helm, lays down the ground rules for everyone.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3004030
text: Ban is chomping at the bit to fight Meliodas. King is also extremely ready to knock out anyone in his way.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3004040
text: King realizes that Howzer is the Holy Knight who was with Gilthunder. This makes Meliodas worry that Howzer might recognize him.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3004050
text: Next up is Matrona and Griamore's match. Matrona is a mysterious girl wearing a disguise, raising some suspicions that she might be a fugitive.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3004060
text: Matrona is revealed to be none other than Diane. Meliodas is unable to recognize her, however, as she appears to be much smaller.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3004070
text: The next match is Cain vs. Old Fart. Diane makes fun of how stupid the name "Old Fart" is.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3004080
text: It's Meliodas and Ban's turn to fight. The two of them seem pretty excited about getting the chance to beat the stuffing out of each other.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3004090
text: It's time for a match between Howzer and Matrona, the festival's sole female fighter.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3004100
text: King is unnerved by Cain staring eagle-eyed at Meliodas. Meliodas decides to directly ask Cain what he wants.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3004101
text: Cain tells Meliodas he used to know a "Meliodas" long ago and asks if he's his son. Meliodas clarifies that he's that Meliodas. This incenses Cain, who then declares that Meliodas is not worthy of forgiveness.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3004110
text: Love Helm declares Matrona the winner and proceeds to carry on with Meliodaf and Cain's match.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3004111
text: Cain unleashes his fury upon Meliodas. Meliodas says he feels guilty for being unable to protect everyone before. He adds that he's vowed to make sure he will from now on.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3004120
text: Diane is thrilled to be matched up with Meliodas in the finals. Meliodas is more preoccupied with how they'll almost certainly acquire the Sacred Treasure.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3004130
text: Meliodas evacuates the festival-goers and deals with the Holy Knights in a secure location.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3004140
text: Meliodas has lost his broken blade, but he's just glad that Elizabeth is okay.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3005000
text: Meliodas and crew decide to embark on a journey to find the rest of [The Seven Deadly Sins]: Gowther, Merlin, and Escanor.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3005001
text: Meliodas and crew settle down by a forest near Ordan Village. Meliodas asks Elizabeth to put up tavern advertisements around the village with Hawk.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3005010
text: Meliodas proposes making a hunting bet to Ban and King. This sparks Ban's competitive streak.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3005020
text: Meliodas and crew hear an unidentified noise and start guessing what it could be.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3005030
text: Cain reminisces about Danafor's past and tells Elizabeth how glad he is to be able to deliver Liz's sword with her help. He also asks her to pass his thanks to Meliodas.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3005040
text: Elizabeth introduces herself to Gowther. Gowther surprises everyone when he first declines to rejoin [The Seven Deadly Sins], but he soon concedes.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3005041
text: Meliodas emphasizes the need to bolster everyone's powers in preparation for the future. King and Gowther agree.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3005050
text: Meliodas suggests heading to the capital to retrieve the broken blade, but the others aren't so keen on the idea and refuse.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3005060
text: The broken blade is one of the fragments that sealed away the Demons, and the Holy Knights intend to gather these fragments in a plot to resurrect them...

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3005070
text: Gowther has reunited with [The Seven Deadly Sins]. In light of this, Ban proposes building a celebratory campfire to Meliodas.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3005080
text: As Meliodas's party gets closer to Liones, their approach is hastily reported by the kingdom's Holy Knights.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3005081
text: Diane crash-lands in town after getting hit with Dreyfus's attack. Guila rushes over, worried about Zeal.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3005090
text: After breaching the North Gate, Meliodas's party wonders if Diane's crew can keep up.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006010
text: Facing off against Hendrickson for the first time in 10 years, Meliodas requests that he let Elizabeth go. Hendrickson flatly refuses.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006020
text: Gilthunder states he hasn't forgotten the Knight's Code he learned "that day" and repeats what he said in the Forest of White Dreams: "I am now more powerful than any of the [The Seven Deadly Sins]."

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006021
text: With Arthur out of the fight, Meliodas ends up facing three enemies on his own.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006030
text: Margaret teeters at top of the gates looking like she might throw herself down any minute. She cries out at Gilthunder to stop.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006040
text: Freed from his binds, Gilthunder asks Meliodas to take revenge on Hendrickson.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006050
text: Vivian is unable to accept Gilthunder's betrayal, flying into a rage when things becomes clear.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006060
text: Merlin questions Vivian about Elizabeth's whereabouts. Vivian reveals that Elizabeth is being held in the king's chambers and makes a quick escape.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006070
text: Dreyfus finally reveals himself. Margaret claims that Hendrickson and Dreyfus are the ones who murdered Zaratras 10 years ago. Dreyfus falls to his knees, ready to confess.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006071
text: Merlin and Arthur travel to Camelot to cure the enfeebled King Bartra. Meliodas, Elizabeth, Gilthunder, and Margaret are the only ones left when they feel a tremendous, thunderous quake.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006072
text: Elizabeth confirms that everyone made it out of the collapsed castle. Meliodas still wonders about the others' safety away from the group.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006090
text: An injured, weak Diane staggers along under the withering treatment of the villagers. Guila is taken aback when her younger brother, Zeal, shows up as she watches from the sidelines.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006100
text: Dreyfus and Helbram try their best to persuade Howzer and Guila, but the two remain resolute.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006110
text: Gowther states he's ascertained what's happening by looking through Dreyfus's and Guila's memories, saying that he intends to speak with Dreyfus directly.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006120
text: Dreyfus writhes in torment from Gowther's nightmarish mental attacks. Gowther is certain that victory will be his.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006121
text: Gowther senses a presence just when he thinks he's won. Dreyfus breaks free and snaps back to reality before Gowther, but he retreats with Gilthunder due to the heavy injuries he sustained.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006130
text: King blames himself for not protecting Diane. Helbram adds salt to the wound by saying this is all because King showed up too late.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006140
text: King describes how precious Diane is to him, and Helbram vows to show King how painful it is to bear witness to the destruction of someone he holds dear.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006150
text: A long time ago in the peaceful Fairy King's Forest, King was wary of Helbram's affection for Humans. When cautioned against trusting them, Helbram asked King to stop him in the future.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006160
text: King wraps up his business and attends to Diane. Howzer questions the treason charges against [The Seven Deadly Sins] and learns why they came to the capital.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006170
text: Jericho and Guila writhe on the ground in pain. Gowther comments on the similarities between their transformation and Dale's.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006180
text: New Generation Mutants wreak havoc on the capital of Liones. Meliodas decides to stop the rampaging Holy Knights.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006190
text: Hendrickson offers to spare Meliodas's life in exchange for handing Elizabeth over. Meliodas firmly rejects him.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006200
text: Meliodas wants Ban to come with him and rescue Elizabeth, but Ban doesn't seem very enthusiastic about the idea.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006210
text: Meliodas tells Ban to kill him. Touched by Meliodas's words, Ban thanks him.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006220
text: Meliodas asks Hawk to take him to Elizabeth. Ban also entrusts Meliodas to Hawk's care.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006230
text: Merlin says the Coffin of Eternal Darkness has vanished. She claims a strange creature flew south immediately after Hendrickson's defeat. What could it be?

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006240
text: Merlin says a group of likeminded people have gathered in the West District to form an order of knights and suggests it might be worth a visit.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006390
text: When Merlin asks Meliodas what he plans to do, he immediately replies, "Develop a new menu." The jury's still out on whether any of these new dishes will be edible.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006400
text: Meliodas is hard at work developing a new menu. Elizabeth worries that they don't have a main ingredient, but Meliodas tells her it's not a problem.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006401
text: Gilthunder and Howzer are still hungover when Meliodas wakes them, intending to test his new, undeniably pig-shaped meat pie.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006410
text: Fearing he might end up as an ingredient in Meliodas's meat pie, Hawk runs from the tavern. When Elizabeth starts to worry, Meliodas puts up a reward and sets a plan in motion to capture Hawk.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006420
text: Gilthunder, Elizabeth, and Meliodas set out together in search of Hawk. Elizabeth and Gilthunder start talking about the past. Why does Gilthunder constantly refer to Hawk as Pork?

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006430
text: Hawk eventually slips away. Meliodas is suddenly curious how Diane, King, and Howzer are doing.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006440
text: The plan to capture Hawk fails. Meliodas and crew decide to head back to the tavern for now.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006450
text: Despite successfully luring Hawk back with his cooking, Ban loses out on the reward due to Meliodas's trickery. Why did Ban decide to help capture Hawk?

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006452
text: Meliodas seems oblivious to Elizabeth's concerns when he agrees to be her chaperone.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006453
text: Meliodas escorts Elizabeth to the castle. After parting ways, Meliodas doesn't head for the tavern. He's headed somewhere else.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006454
text: Meliodas gets up bright and early to head to the Mountain Peak. For some strange reason, Hawk insists on coming with him...

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006460
text: Barely awake, Howzer runs into Diane heading somewhere early in the morning. He has mixed feelings when he learns Diane is taking a shrinking potion to avoid scaring people with her size.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006461
text: Howzer tells King that the capital's residents may have hurt Diane's feelings. He leaves the tavern in search of Diane.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006470
text: A carpenter asks Diane for help transporting bricks meant to restore the district. Diane gladly agrees.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006480
text: The carpenter's hammer is missing. Diane offers to find it in the carpenter's stead.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006490
text: Diane proposes a game of tag to King. She promises to do anything he wants if he can catch her.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006500
text: A wedding is thrown into chaos by the sudden appearance of a Mutant. King and Diane decide to join forces to defeat it.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006510
text: King has no recollection of his day with Diane. Diane won't tell him anything either. King tries his best to remember, but it's not coming back to him easily.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006511
text: Elizabeth shows up early in the morning with urgent news to share.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006520
text: Everyone is having a nice night when Ban tells Meliodas to come outside. Apparently, he has something to say to him.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006521
text: Ban and King's absence on the morning of the medal bestowment ceremony puzzles Hawk.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006530
text: Dogedo is the first one to respond to Meliodas's provocations. Can he really beat Meliodas?

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006531
text: Hawk receives Balor's Evil Eye as a gift from Merlin. While testing it out, Merlin pranks Hawk into thinking his power level is 3,000.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006532
text: Having seen the full extent of Meliodas's powers, [The Pleiades of the Azure Sky] retreat without further protest.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006540
text: Meliodas wants Elizabeth to hang on to King's and Ban's medals since they've left [The Seven Deadly Sins]. She realizes she's experienced all of this in a dream filling her with dread.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006550
text: Meliodas and crew run into the Trio of Troublemakers on their way back to the tavern. They seem to be greatly troubled by Dreyfus's recently exposed two-faced behavior.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006560
text: Meliodas is about to embark on a journey to stop [The Ten Commandments]. Elizabeth wants to come with him, but he refuses to let her join.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006561
text: Merlin gives Gowther a potion. Gowther spits it out upon leaving the laboratory.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006562
text: Gowther's rejection puts Meliodas in a tight spot, but he decides to meet up with Merlin nonetheless...

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006563
text: Meliodas and Merlin sense Gowther's power coming from the West District. They head over in a hurry.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006570
text: Diane and Elizabeth share their feelings with each other. At that moment, they spot Guila's brother, Zeal, weeping as he approaches from the distance...

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006573
text: Diane takes Zeal to Guila, but Guila is unable to recognize him. Diane intuits that Gowther's power is responsible.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006574
text: Diane warns Gowther about recklessly tampering with other people's memories, but Gowther ignores her.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006580
text: Meliodas is tempted to ask Gowther what happened, but he decides to prioritize rectifying the issue at hand and attempts to wake Guila.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006590
text: After cleaning up the mess in the town's district, Merlin tries to hold Gowther accountable for what happened.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006591
text: People are surprised to see Gowther as a doll. The gang decides to head to the tavern and assess the situation.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006600
text: Elizabeth once again declares that she'd like to accompany Meliodas, and he shuts her down again. A hurt Elizabeth storms out of the tavern.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006610
text: While discussing the tavern's poor performance with Elizabeth and Hawk, Meliodas is hit with a great idea.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006620
text: After getting scolded by his father, Howzer heads to the West District with Gilthunder and Griamore.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006630
text: Howzer and Griamore keep getting caught up in strange incidents after pranking Gilthunder. Meliodas and Gowther quickly realize something fishy's going on.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006631
text: Meliodas ascertains the stalker's identity. He decides to trail the stalker again in hopes of capturing them.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006640
text: Gowther gets nabbed by Pelio and agrees to entertain him for a little while. Could this be the start of a new [Seven Deadly Sins]?

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006650
text: Gowther listens to Pelio's story about his mother, to whom he bears a resemblance.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006660
text: The Trio of Troublemakers decide to take a short break. Someone at the cafe seems to be up to no good, however!

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006670
text: Vivian is furious when her plans to feed Gilthunder her Elixir of Love are thwarted.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006680
text: Case closed. Meliodas attempts to take Vivian to the laboratory.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3006690
text: After punishing Vivian, Merlin turns her focus towards fulfilling Meliodas's request like she promised.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3007000
text: Already startled by the sudden teleportation, Hawk can't keep his mouth closed when he sees a monster as big as a mountain.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3007010
text: Merlin deducts that the monster before them must be a type of Golem. Meliodas tells her that the monster is Albion, a weapon created by the Demons.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3007020
text: Arthur is glad to see that Meliodas came to his aid in a time of need.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3007021
text: Merlin reveals that it was she who took away Meliodas's power before he went berserk 10 years ago. She declares that Meliodas will need to regain the power she took if they are to face against [The Ten Commandments].

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3007030
text: Arthur feels both grateful and sorry that Meliodas came to his aid because his sword had been shattered in the process.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3007040
text: The group cheers when Meliodas's attack takes down the Albion.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3007041
text: Ban says he has no intention of returning to [The Seven Deadly Sins]. Ban's stubbornness frustrates King.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3007042
text: Ban tells King to go back since Diane is waiting for him, but King doesn't believe him. Ban maintains that he's telling the truth.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3007050
text: Ban says he has no intention of becoming the Fairy King and convinces them to drop the idea.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3007060
text: Arthur is taken aback when he hears that [The Ten Commandments] have been freed from their seal. The group wonders if a "Full Counter" bolstered by the Sacred Treasure Lostvayne could reflect all attacks. Meanwhile, Diane feels a strange dizziness once again.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3007061
text: King asks Jericho why she's following them, and Ban recalls the time they were rescuing Elizabeth.\nBan steps forward, saying he'll kill the Demon blood-infused Jericho himself.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3007062
text: Jericho has a lot on her mind after she is saved by Ban.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3007070
text: Galland is happy to see Meliodas. Seeing Galland's incredibly high Combat Class, Hawk believes Balor's Evil Eye is broken. However, Merlin is hopeful after seeing that his power has been almost fully depleted.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3007080
text: The group thinks Merlin sent Galland to a different location, but he had actually escaped Merlin's magic zone with an instantaneous leap. The group's safety is threatened once again.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3007090
text: The group is shocked when they see how much stronger Galland is. As the fight goes on, [The Ten Commandments] come up with a plan to regain their powers by devouring Human souls. Meliodas unleashes his power in order to defeat Galland.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3007100
text: Arthur, Elizabeth, and Hawk are freed when Merlin's "Perfect Cube" fades, also undoing Gowther's doll form in the process. Merlin's Sacred Treasure heads toward something as he's about to leave.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3007110
text: When he wakes up, Meliodas wonders why Galland would retreat. It turns out Gowther manipulated Galland's memories and tricked him into thinking he killed everyone. Merlin, who moved her soul into the Morning Star Aldan, reveals that she put a bracelet on Gowther to keep him under control.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3007111
text: Meliodas and crew come across screaming soldiers who are frightened out of their wits. They reveal that mages have been using fragments from the Albion to create Golems and ask the gang for their help.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3007112
text: Soldiers come to thank the gang for taking down the Golems. Meliodas and crew say it was no big deal, and begin heading toward the castle.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3007120
text: Merlin says everyone must give their all to close the gap in Combat Classes against [The Ten Commandments]. She also says it's time to find the last member of [The Seven Deadly Sins].

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3007130
text: Diane doesn't remember Elizabeth and doubts her.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3007140
text: Merlin says there's a chance Diane's amnesia came from severe head trauma.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3007150
text: While talking about Diane's situation, the group decided to check on Diane. It turns out Diane was trying to leave the castle, despite the sentries' best efforts to stop her.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3007160
text: King is shocked when he hears that Diane left in a hurry. While King wonders where she could have gone, Gowther gives him a clue.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3007161
text: Gowther confesses that it was he who erased Diane's memories. King is furious to hear that Gowther was only testing out a theory.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3007162
text: The crew tries to figure out Diane's whereabouts. They decide to look for her in the Giants' Village of Megadozer where she lived before joining [The Seven Deadly Sins].

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3007163
text: On their journey to find the truth, the Trio of Troublemakers get into an argument about how they each view Dreyfus. The commotion draws a gang of bandits.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3007170
text: Griamore and Howzer always get into petty arguments. While Gilthunder watches and shakes his head, he notices some people standing around strangely. While investigating, the Holy Knights hear a woman's scream and hurriedly move to find her.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3007180
text: Griamore protects everyone except Hendrickson from the Demon's attack with his ability. Howzer protests, but Hendrickson tells them that he's fine. He is eager to destroy the Demon before them.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3007190
text: Hendrickson uses "Purge" on the enemies. The Trio of Troublemakers are surprised with what they see, and Hendrickson reveals the truth behind past events.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3007200
text: Meliodas and crew avoid danger thanks to Hawk's Mama. King is taken aback when Merlin requests a change in destination.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3008010
text: The leaders of the Druids already knew the purpose of the group's visit. The leaders wish to test their determination before agreeing to help.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3008020
text: Jenna wants to test the group's skills and determination through combat.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3008060
text: Jenna acknowledges that the group has passed the test.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3008070
text: While heading to the Tower of Trials, Elizabeth wonders whether Zaneri has feelings for Meliodas.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3008080
text: Meliodas's mind begins to be tested. Meanwhile, Zaneri gives Elizabeth a test as well in order to prepare for the fight ahead.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3008090
text: Meliodas finds himself in the past. Before he can even adjust to his surroundings, Liz pressures Meliodas.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3008100
text: Seeing Elizabeth worrying for Meliodas and unable to focus on her test, Zaneri tells her the purpose of the test.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3008110
text: Meliodas's mind goes back in time again. In a time of peace, without a worry in the world, Meliodas begins sparring with his allies.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3008120
text: While Meliodas is enjoying small talk with his comrades, he is taken back to the most painful moment.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3008130
text: The torment repeats itself, and Meliodas loses himself to wrath again. Zaneri suggests he give up the test, but Meliodas won't back down.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3008140
text: Meliodas's mind is dragged back into the past. Before Meliodas can adjust to his surroundings, a soldier tells him that the kingdom is under attack. Meliodas raises his sword, ready to protect a kingdom that had already vanished long ago.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3008150
text: Meliodas saves the kingdom from danger. He and Liz share a few jokes, but he knows how this will end. So he tries to forget.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3008160
text: Meliodas is dragged back into the time of the attack on Danafor. He tries to rescue Liz who is headed to the preordained tragedy when a Demon interferes.

name: DB_cutscene_summary_3008180
